commit_message:
Switch containerized job to Octavia

As our default LB choice is Octavia, this commit moves containerized
LBaaS v2 job to exeprimental queue and promotes containerized Octavia
job to check and gate queues.

Change-Id: Idb1a8b4b17dd9b13f63c1b01f9291e7f02d1663e

commit_message:
Remove Cinder API v1 compatibility

Since Cinder API v1 is removed in I03bf2db5bd7e2fdfb4f6032758ccaf2b348a82ba
we don't need _replace_v2_parameters function anymore.

Change-Id: I18c2787241f1dcbe4c0afc14a76630d9bfb1162a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/75/505175/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def _replace_v2_parameters(data): if VERSIONS.active < 2: data['display_name'] = data['name'] data['display_description'] = data['description'] del data['name'] del data['description'] return data data = _replace_v2_parameters(data) vol_data = _replace_v2_parameters(vol_data) data = _replace_v2_parameters(data) snapshot_data = _replace_v2_parameters(snapshot_data)

commit_message:
Redirect the old baremetal install-guide for master to its current location

People seem to find /project-install-guide/baremetal/draft pretty often,
and assume that it's the up-to-date installation docs for ironic, while
in reality it is frozen at some point around Pike. Let us redirect
to the actual master installation docs.

Change-Id: I32b5fc3e0d6e18c5804b80b8bc2d6d976a689ba8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/06/571206/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
osprofiler support redis

Currently osprofiler only choose elasticsearch,
which is only supported on x86.
On other platform like aarch64 osprofiler can
not be used since no elasticsearch package.

Enable osprofiler by enable_osprofiler: "yes",
which choose elasticsearch by default.
Choose redis by enable_redis: "yes" & osprofiler_backend: "redis"
On platform without elasticsearch support like aarch64
set enable_elasticsearch: "no"

Change-Id: I68fe7a33e11d28684962fc5d0b3d326e90784d78

commit_message:
snmp: ignore rfc1905.NoSuchInstance result

If the SNMP polling return such a value, it should be ignored.

Change-Id: I275f43f8800d9477fedd100db68b48c93e7ad75d
(cherry picked from commit 93eca81e588465da9900202b32bdcd8ddad0d866)

commit_message:
Decouple OpenShiftGlusterDisks from openshift-master.yaml

In the event you have different disks in nodes assigned to each role
you may need to pass role specific parameters, e.g like:

parameter_defaults:
  OpenShiftMasterParameters:
    OpenShiftGlusterDisks:
      - /dev/vdc
  OpenShiftWorkerParameters:
    OpenShiftGlusterDisks:
      - /dev/vdd

To enable that we create an inventory file per role, and pass the directory
of files to ansible.

Change-Id: I8b4d8698405ffb004b081e1f097f300216edfa77

commit_message:
Add setup script for kolla-cli / kolla-ansible

Created new cli-setup.py script that automates the previously
manual process to create the directories needed for the kolla-cli
and kolla-ansible.  It also improves on the process by leaving the
globals.yml file in place in /etc/kolla and just creating a link
to the group_vars/__GLOBALS__ so that both the kolla-ansible and
kolla-cli commands will work correctly, rather than having their
functioning being mutually exclusive.  Due to kolla-ansible still
expecting to be run as root for most actions the cli_setup.py
script should also be run via sudo.

Change-Id: I5b59317b2c22d10dd82623a548b64f387b6bc9d3

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os import sys from kolla_cli.common import utils kolla_ansible_source_base = '../kolla-ansible' kolla_ansible_home_target = utils.get_kolla_ansible_home() kolla_ansible_etc_target = utils.get_kolla_etc() ansible = 'ansible' kolla = 'kolla' kolla_cli = 'kolla-cli' tools = 'tools' def setup_ansible_etc(): # if the kolla-cli directory for the inventory doesn't exist # already then make it. this will also create the directory the # globals and password file goes into cli_etc_dir = os.path.join(kolla_ansible_etc_target, kolla_cli, ansible) if not os.path.exists(cli_etc_dir): print('running - mkdir -p %s' % cli_etc_dir) utils.run_cmd('mkdir -p %s' % cli_etc_dir) inventory_file_path = os.path.join(cli_etc_dir, 'inventory.json') if not os.path.exists(inventory_file_path): print('running - touch %s' % inventory_file_path) utils.run_cmd('touch %', inventory_file_path) # copy over all kolla ansible etc files kolla_ansible_etc_source = os.path.join(kolla_ansible_source_base, 'etc', kolla) print('running - cp -a %s %s' % (kolla_ansible_etc_source, kolla_ansible_etc_target)) utils.run_cmd('cp -a %s %s' % (kolla_ansible_etc_source, kolla_ansible_etc_target)) def setup_ansible_home(): # make cli home ansible directory cli_ansible_dir = os.path.join(kolla_ansible_home_target, kolla_cli, ansible) if not os.path.exists(cli_ansible_dir): print('running - mkdir -p %s' % cli_ansible_dir) utils.run_cmd('mkdir -p %s' % cli_ansible_dir) # make cli home tools directory cli_tools_dir = os.path.join(kolla_ansible_home_target, kolla_cli, tools) if not os.path.exists(cli_tools_dir): print('running - mkdir -p %s' % cli_tools_dir) utils.run_cmd('mkdir -p %s' % cli_tools_dir) # move cli tools files to tools directory print('running - cp -a %s %s' % ('./tools/*', cli_tools_dir)) utils.run_cmd('cp -a %s %s' % ('./tools/*', cli_tools_dir)) # create cli ansible lock file lock_file_path = os.path.join(kolla_ansible_home_target, kolla_cli, 'ansible.lock') if not os.path.exists(lock_file_path): print('running - touch %s' % lock_file_path) utils.run_cmd('touch %s' % lock_file_path) # copy over all kolla ansible home files kolla_ansible_home_source = os.path.join(kolla_ansible_source_base, ansible) print('running - cp -a %s %s' % (kolla_ansible_home_source, kolla_ansible_home_target)) utils.run_cmd('cp -a %s %s' % (kolla_ansible_home_source, kolla_ansible_home_target)) # create the host_vars directory if it doesn't exist already host_vars_path = os.path.join(kolla_ansible_home_target, ansible, 'host_vars') if not os.path.exists(host_vars_path): print('running - mkdir %s' % host_vars_path) utils.run_cmd('mkdir %s' % host_vars_path) # make link from etc globals to home globals target_etc_path = os.path.join(kolla_ansible_etc_target, 'globals.yml') target_home_link = os.path.join(kolla_ansible_home_target, ansible, 'group_vars', '__GLOBAL__') if not os.path.exists(target_home_link): print('running ln -s %s %s' % (target_etc_path, target_home_link)) utils.run_cmd('ln -s %s %s' % (target_etc_path, target_home_link)) def main(): """make sure kolla-ansible and cli files are in the right places""" if len(sys.argv) >= 2: global kolla_ansible_source_base kolla_ansible_source_base = sys.argv[1] setup_ansible_etc() setup_ansible_home() if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
Add a new tempest job with a mock datasource

In this tempest job, the mock datasource is used to create an entity
graph with ~20,000 vertices. This job will contain tests for
init procedure, processes, restarts, multiple api calls.

Other data sources are disabled. Heat, Telemetry, Mistral
are not installed.

This commit includes the first two tests, both using a template where
each action causes another action (three levels).
one test restarts vitrage-graph so the init procedure evaluates this template.
the other test does not restart. result should be the same.

Change-Id: I9c4c329983bbe5930de5484fa6932b318746ed5c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage-tempest-plugin refs/changes/50/572350/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2018 - Nokia # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from concurrent import futures import time from oslo_log import log as logging from vitrage_tempest_plugin.tests.common.constants import VertexProperties from vitrage_tempest_plugin.tests.common import general_utils as g_utils from vitrage_tempest_plugin.tests.common.tempest_clients import TempestClients from vitrage_tempest_plugin.tests.common import vitrage_utils as v_utils from vitrage_tempest_plugin.tests.e2e.test_actions_base import TestActionsBase from vitrage_tempest_plugin.tests import utils LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) DEDUCED_1 = 'mock_datasource.3rd_degree_scenarios.deduced.alarm1' DEDUCED_2 = 'mock_datasource.3rd_degree_scenarios.deduced.alarm2' SLEEP = 40 class TestLongProcessing(TestActionsBase): @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(TestLongProcessing, cls).setUpClass() cls._instances = TempestClients.vitrage().resource.list( all_tenants=True, resource_type='nova.instance') v_utils.delete_template( name="mock_datasource_3rd_degree_scenarios.yaml") time.sleep(SLEEP) @utils.tempest_logger def test_3rd_degree_scenarios(self): try: v_utils.add_template("mock_datasource_3rd_degree_scenarios.yaml") time.sleep(SLEEP) self._check_template_instance_3rd_degree_scenarios() except Exception as e: self._handle_exception(e) raise finally: v_utils.delete_template( name="mock_datasource_3rd_degree_scenarios.yaml") time.sleep(SLEEP) @utils.tempest_logger def test_3rd_degree_scenarios_init_procedure(self): try: v_utils.add_template("mock_datasource_3rd_degree_scenarios.yaml") time.sleep(SLEEP) v_utils.restart_graph() time.sleep(SLEEP) self._check_template_instance_3rd_degree_scenarios() except Exception as e: self._handle_exception(e) raise finally: v_utils.delete_template( name="mock_datasource_3rd_degree_scenarios.yaml") time.sleep(SLEEP) def _check_template_instance_3rd_degree_scenarios(self, ): try: alarm_count = TempestClients.vitrage().alarm.count( all_tenants=True) self.assertEqual( len(self._instances), alarm_count['SEVERE'], 'Each instance should have one SEVERE deduced alarm') self.assertEqual( len(self._instances), alarm_count['CRITICAL'], 'Each instance should have one CRITICAL deduced alarm') expected_rca = [{VertexProperties.VITRAGE_TYPE: 'zabbix'}] * self.\ conf.mock_graph_datasource.zabbix_alarms_per_host expected_rca.extend([{'name': DEDUCED_1}, {'name': DEDUCED_2}]) def check_rca(alarm): rca = TempestClients.vitrage().rca.get(alarm['vitrage_id']) try: self._check_rca(rca, expected_rca, alarm) return True except Exception as e: LOG.exception('Failed', e) return False # 10 threads calling rca api alarms = TempestClients.vitrage().alarm.list(all_tenants=True, vitrage_id='all') deduced_alarms = g_utils.all_matches( alarms, vitrage_type='vitrage', name=DEDUCED_2) workers = futures.ThreadPoolExecutor(max_workers=10) workers_result = [r for r in workers.map(check_rca, deduced_alarms[0:40])] self.assertTrue(all(workers_result)) except Exception as e: v_utils.delete_template( name="mock_datasource_3rd_degree_scenarios.yaml") self._handle_exception(e) raise

commit_message:
Fix typo in config-download template so it match neturon api

The DeployedServerPortMap need to use keys matching the neutron
api. This change replaces 'subnet' with 'subnets'.

Related-Bug: #1772396
Change-Id: I8fdc7e711972e7ac488216db35409058c2c9cbcc

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6b107fce3daa8292b5fe6b5730a03008bf8987f0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cliff refs/changes/01/572901/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I9a8f7b1734b23751e47297a15676219627969d7c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/automaton refs/changes/68/572868/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Using oslo.policy for monasca-api

Added policies and used policy enforcement engine
from monasca-common.

- Replaced security with oslo.policy
- Updated unit tests and implemented some new tests
- Added a new entry point for generating sample policy file by tox

story: 2001233
task: 6355

Change-Id: I4aa444fe6ec883160c03c201145c77994b6615f9
Signed-off-by: Amir Mofakhar <amofakhar@op5.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia0bccf6ed1b28f64622217d88dc6401ba6bd4406
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I1a478fc7568d350e77773edbf7ac3b4c3e50cff2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects refs/changes/88/572888/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I31a207868c07e08ae27c14635d52506021032cb7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Pin cmd2 to the last python2 version of the library

The cmd2-0.9.0 is python3-only and the tempest venv is built
unconstrained, so it's trying to bring in the latest version
which is incompatible with python2. We pin the library to
ensure that the venv build completes correctly.

Depends-On: I35e3688ae632d5f7747f32dafc41d23883c033c5
Change-Id: Id5b9274ce39dec3d5ee295d7ef941bf42ca7cbd2
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8c7b78424f699f19ea0a11e4c9dfee78cee1976f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest refs/changes/37/572037/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - cmd2<0.9.0 # >=0.9.0 is python3 only

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Decode subprocess output so it has the right type under python 3.

Change-Id: Id2df5439fa6e788199bec4ac7c98c56347053621
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Stop showing passwords when bootstrap script is ran
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-07 07:56:07.000000000', 'files': ['docker/keystone/keystone/keystone_bootstrap.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/244e71a59aec283869882137b4f3696f055d1af0', 'message': 'Stop showing passwords when bootstrap script is ran

Currently this causes bash to echo all lines parsed
and executed; which makes it not so nicely output the
bootstrapping password.

Stop showing passwords when bootstrap script is ran

Currently this causes bash to echo all lines parsed
and executed; which makes it not so nicely output the
bootstrapping password.

This is not something we should encourage and have show
up in peoples logs or other so stop doing that.

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7150a260a3b423b138a710edf71efaa8762cd849
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-vif refs/changes/22/572922/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7874fc8375c14fcc9567b6c23bc1c070bc6d29c9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osc-placement refs/changes/17/572917/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Add .rst files check to pep8

Errors in README.rst prevent the package from being registered in Pypi. We would like pep8 to fail in these cases.
For more details, see: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131233.html

Change-Id: I8a6c333c4c968054fe8b63bdf844fe8d94ce98b5

commit_message:
Refactor exception handling in cmd.api

Replace the known exception tuple with a map of exception classes
to error codes to preserve backward compatibility of exit codes.
Also change the code to handle unknown members of the Exception
hierarchy without breaking.

Co-authored-by: jiangpch <jiangpengcheng@navercorp.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1726213

Change-Id: Iabfc2ded45a576a18bdb30a6c3ada8b9799a3196
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/14/514114/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Updating time for functional tests

Currenlty, some gates is being failed with logs like this

"""
b'Response: {"description": "Provided object does not match schema
\'Secret\': \'expiration\' is before current time.
Invalid property: \'expiration\'", "title": "Bad Request", "code": 400}'
"""

So it is necessary to update the time to create secrets successfully.

Change-Id: I4f2d3817d9a2380919d16e76ef5dcba3ec62e5a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-barbicanclient refs/changes/21/550621/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
tox: Switch basepython to 3

Python 3 is coming. Switch everything that isn't explicitly targeted to
a specific version to Python 3, allowing us to validate what will soon
be the primary target.

Change-Id: Ic4187023b9163d4c145d7c5061c0af9ee3ff97be

subject: Dockerfile to run unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-29 08:59:41.000000000', 'files': ['Dockerfile'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/7f7c520343dbe27c84fd2bc77bc10570094dc1c1', 'message': 'Dockerfile to run unit tests

Docker containers are very useful for developers because they are
lighter than VMs and permits to have snapshots of each image, allowing
the developer to quickly check changes between different commits and to
have a clean environment to test their changes. Also, they can be used
in the CI system, freeing up resources.

This Dockerfile permits to create a container with all the requirements
needed to run the unit tests, you have to follow the next steps (ipv6 has to
be enabled in your docker daemon [1]):

1. Build the docker image to run your unit tests (it only depends on the
test-requirements.txt file):

    docker build -t neutron-dev:23sdf .

2. Run your container to set up your test environment mounting your
local folder so you can have access to the artifacts outside of the
container:

docker run -itv $(pwd):/neutron --privileged --sysctl \
    net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6=0  neutron:23sdf bash

3. Run the unit tests inside the container:

cd /neutron
tox -e py27

[1] https://docs.docker.com/config/daemon/ipv6/

Related-Bug: #1773818

Change-Id: I5973c8772d3ca530f9e30710759425adc18994d2
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Dockerfile to run unit tests

Docker containers are very useful for developers because they are
lighter than VMs and permits to have snapshots of each image, allowing
the developer to quickly check changes between different commits and to
have a clean environment to test their changes. Also, they can be used
in the CI system, freeing up resources.

This Dockerfile permits to create a container with all the requirements
needed to run the unit tests, you have to follow the next steps (ipv6 has to
be enabled in your docker daemon [1]):

1. Build the docker image to run your unit tests (it only depends on the
test-requirements.txt file):

    docker build -t neutron-dev:23sdf .

2. Run your container to set up your test environment mounting your
local folder so you can have access to the artifacts outside of the
container:

docker run -itv $(pwd):/neutron --privileged --sysctl \
    net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6=0  neutron:23sdf bash

3. Run the unit tests inside the container:

cd /neutron
tox -e py27

[1] https://docs.docker.com/config/daemon/ipv6/

Related-Bug: #1773818

Change-Id: I5973c8772d3ca530f9e30710759425adc18994d2
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/71/570871/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FROM ubuntu:16.04 ENV DEBIAN_FRONTEND noninteractive RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git \ python-pip gettext haproxy libffi-dev \ libmysqlclient-dev libssl-dev mysql-client \ bridge-utils vim python3.5 RUN pip install tox ADD test-requirements.txt /tmp/test-requirements.txt RUN pip install -r /tmp/test-requirements.txt

Doc for multi node development

Add the start of a document describing options for multi node
development.

added_lines: .. multi-node: ======================================= Kolla Kubernetes Multi-Node Devel Guide ======================================= wget https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/releases/download/v1.3.5/kubernetes.tar.gz tar -zxvf kubernetes.tar.gz cd kubernetes export KUBERNETES_PROVIDER=vagrant export NUM_MINIONS=2 ./cluster/kube-up.sh kubectl get nodes label one node as compute, another as compute like: kubectl label node <node1> kolla_controller=v1 kubectl label node <node2> kolla_compute=v1 Then follow the directions in the Multi-Node Guide.

commit_message:
Service and Mariadb operator template

The operator needs a series of templates so
Kubernetes can understand how the container will
run.

commit_message:
WIP Hierarchical approach for helm charts

This PS introduce an alternative approach in storing helm chart. The top
of hierarchy is kolla-kubernetes, with childs as main openstack services
and sub-childs as microservices. This approach allows to keep global
variables at parent level, service specific variables at service level
and sub-child variable at corresponding sub-child level. with HELM 2.1
we will be able to deploy a single microservice but with all variables
defined at parent and child levels, which makes it very flexible.

Change-Id: I5739dea54a888eb660dd44d0f496a8ec81f1565e
Partially-Implements: blueprint helm-packaging

commit_message:
DO_NOT_MERGE PoC Configmap update monitor

This PS is PoC of one of possible solution for implementing
config change propagation to POD running a service which consumes
configuration from its configmap.

Change-Id: I5b77851e8650307d53476b1d42b3510c04b92a54

added_lines: apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1 kind: DaemonSet metadata: name: configmap-updater namespace: default spec: template: metadata: labels: component: configmap-monitor system: kube annotations: pod.alpha.kubernetes.io/initialized: "true" pod.alpha.kubernetes.io/init-containers: '[ { "name": "copy-config", "image": "docker.io/port/centos-binary-kolla-kube-toolbox:3.0.1", "command": [ "/bin/sh", "-c", "cp -a /tmp/main-process-configmap/..data/* /tmp/pod-main-config/; kubectl get configmap main-process-configmap -o json | jq -r ''.metadata.resourceVersion '' > /tmp/configmap-monitor/configmap-version.txt; " ], "volumeMounts": [ { "name": "pod-main-config", "mountPath": "/tmp/pod-main-config" }, { "name": "configmap-monitor", "mountPath": "/tmp/configmap-monitor" }, { "name": "main-process-configmap", "mountPath": "/tmp/main-process-configmap" } ] } ]' spec: containers: - image: docker.io/port/centos-binary-kolla-kube-toolbox:3.0.1 name: main command: - /bin/bash - -c - | config_value=$(cat /tmp/main-process-config/config.json | jq -r '.variable '); while true; do echo $config_value; sleep 10; done; volumeMounts: - mountPath: /tmp/main-process-config name: pod-main-config - image: docker.io/port/centos-binary-kolla-kube-toolbox:3.0.1 name: configmap-monitor command: - /bin/bash - -c - | original_version=$(</tmp/configmap-monitor/configmap-version.txt); while true; do current_version=$(kubectl get configmap main-process-configmap -o json | jq -r '.metadata.resourceVersion ') echo "Original version - $original_version, Current version - $current_version"; if [ $original_version != $current_version ]; then echo 'Configmap got changed need to restart POD'; fi; sleep 10; done; volumeMounts: - mountPath: /tmp/configmap-monitor name: configmap-monitor volumes: - name: pod-main-config emptyDir: {} - name: configmap-monitor emptyDir: {} - name: main-process-configmap configMap: name: main-process-configmap --- apiVersion: v1 data: config.json: | { "variable": "old" } kind: ConfigMap metadata: name: main-process-configmap namespace: default

commit_message:
Document some Conventions

To ensure consistency as the project grows, we need to agree to
and document some project conventions.

Change-Id: I830ef8e48e5ea009a5ec607d006d1b4a85d33971
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/86/361186/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. conventions: ============================ Kolla Kubernetes Conventions ============================ Redundant info ============== Kubernetes or kolla-kubernetes resource names should not contain redundant information. For example, instead of this: tools/kolla_kubernetes.py resource-template create glance pod glance-api-pod We should do this: tools/kolla_kubernetes.py resource-template create glance pod api Names are already unique to kubernetes object type and you must specify it. So, instead of this: kubectl get pod glance-api-pod We should do this: kubectl get pod glance-api Container Names =============== Pods can contain multiple containers. To access them, you must specify the pod and the container. Names should be kept short for ease of use and to avoid redundant information. Also, in order to make it easy to switch from a command line to exec into one pod to another or get logs, we should standardize the primary container's name to always be 'main'. Instead of calling pod glance-api's container glance-api, leading to this: kubectl exec -it glance-api -c glance-api /bin/bash We should do this: kubectl exec -it glance-api -c main /bin/bash Kubernetes/Kolla-kubernetes type consistency ============================================ The type in kolla-kubernetes cli's should match the type registered in kubernetes and it should be tagged appropriately on the file system. So, the following should not create a deployment. tools/kolla_kubernetes.py resource-template create glance pod api If it needs to, it should be changed to: tools/kolla_kubernetes.py resource-template create glance deployment api The corresponding template should be named: services/glance/api-deployment.yml.j2

commit_message:
Latest Ceph client flag changed for layering

To enable layering, the flag changed to --image-features
accepting an integer. The int 1 is for layering.

Change-Id: Ib7ba779c1be8226652322c44364a06717b211b9e

subject: Neutron create mariadb failed with wrong login host
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-06 10:55:16.000000000', 'files': ['services/neutron/neutron-bootstrap-job-create-db.yml.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes/commit/7aace37fe6b5305b50ae9b171ed578dd3ece6480', 'message': 'Neutron create mariadb failed with wrong login host

Neutron create mariadb bootstrap will using ##neutron_database_address##
variable as mariadb login host. But the default value was defined in
kolla-ansbile neutron's default variable file. It is "{{
kolla_internal_fqdn }}:{{ database_port }}"

This will cause the login host will be something like "mariadb:3306" It
should be "mariadb" instead of "mariadb:3306" We can just rewrite this
to "mariadb", just like other services (ex: nova or cinder) which how to
create db.

Change-Id: Ib02f3dad80219e13166a58eeb78dee0cabddd8ec
Closed-Bug: 1670318
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron create mariadb failed with wrong login host

Neutron create mariadb bootstrap will using ##neutron_database_address##
variable as mariadb login host. But the default value was defined in
kolla-ansbile neutron's default variable file. It is "{{
kolla_internal_fqdn }}:{{ database_port }}"

This will cause the login host will be something like "mariadb:3306" It
should be "mariadb" instead of "mariadb:3306" We can just rewrite this
to "mariadb", just like other services (ex: nova or cinder) which how to
create db.

Change-Id: Ib02f3dad80219e13166a58eeb78dee0cabddd8ec
Closed-Bug: 1670318
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/75/441875/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "login_host=mariadb "login_host=mariadb

subject: [helm]Create keystone public service failed with nil external vip
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-08 08:54:13.000000000', 'files': ['helm/kolla-common/templates/_common_svc.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes/commit/bae48dbc33d887f5235c05af21138094bda34993', 'message': '[helm]Create keystone public service failed with nil external vip

When user try to install keystone-public-svc with default value.
Helm will installed failed with following messages

$ helm install microservice/keystone-public-svc
Created tunnel using local port: '41270'
SERVER: "localhost:41270"
CHART PATH: /home/lyan/helm/microservice/keystone-public-svc
Error: error validating "": error validating data: unexpected nil value
for field spec.externalIPs[0]

Keystone-public-svc will default enable external port, this will cause
svc yaml will need to get externa_vip value. But it will not been assign
any value. Therefore the svc yaml will output:

```
externalIPs:
    -
```

Maybe we should check whether external port had been enable and external vip had been added,
then assign external vip.

Change-Id: If74b97036d451420a2dbfef2786d9015657a47ac
Closed-Bug: 1670979
'}]
commit_message:
[helm]Create keystone public service failed with nil external vip

When user try to install keystone-public-svc with default value.
Helm will installed failed with following messages

$ helm install microservice/keystone-public-svc
Created tunnel using local port: '41270'
SERVER: "localhost:41270"
CHART PATH: /home/lyan/helm/microservice/keystone-public-svc
Error: error validating "": error validating data: unexpected nil value
for field spec.externalIPs[0]

Keystone-public-svc will default enable external port, this will cause
svc yaml will need to get externa_vip value. But it will not been assign
any value. Therefore the svc yaml will output:

```
externalIPs:
    -
```

Maybe we should check whether external port had been enable and external vip had been added,
then assign external vip.

Change-Id: If74b97036d451420a2dbfef2786d9015657a47ac
Closed-Bug: 1670979

commit_message:
Re-version helm after a release

This tool makes it easy after a commit hash is chosen for
tagging to change the version number rather then scramble prior
to choosing a tag to change version numbers.

Change-Id: I92acb4e5c67b17070f4d17fdce9af47dade68cfb

commit_message:
Kolla Kubernetes Service Discovery BP

The scope of this BP is to make use of existing dynamic dns
functionality in Kubernetes and to introduce the service naming
convention which should be followed while generating service
configuration files.

Implements: Kolla Kubernetes Service Discovery

Change-Id: I03aae9545d1b8cd7b4d695e33434cf6b8cf53d4e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/37/317537/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. =========================== Kolla Kubernetes Service Discovery =========================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/kolla-kubernetes/+spec/kolla-kubernetes-service-discovery Introduction ============ Kubernetes is highly dynamic and flexible environment in which location of services could change as a result of multiple triggers. Discovering the initial location of a service as well as post change location is essential and required functionality for building flexible and elastic infrastructures running on top of Kubernetes. Problem description =================== Kolla Kubernetes deploys OpenStack on top of Kubernetes cluster. In OpenStack environment multiple services depends on other service, example keystone needs mariadb or glance needs keystone service. In conventional OpenStack environment usually the location of these services are hardcoded in the service configuration files. In Kubernetes it is impossible as the ip address is not known before POD with service gets instantiated on one of Kubernetes workers node. Kolla Kubernetes needs to be able to discover and communicate with these services dynamically. Also for successful and efficient service discovery, the service naming convention must be introduced and followed. Use cases --------- 1. When Glance service (or any other OpenStack services) starts, it needs to learn the ip address of keystone container or any other dependent service. 2. To make Container Configuration process consistent, naming convention must be used. Proposed change =============== 1. Require dynamic DNS support on the cluster where Kolla Kubernetes installs OpenStack. 2. Use service naming convention: service-name.namespace Since most of services running on Kubernetes cluster do not have exposure to the outside infrastructure with the exception of keystone port 5000, horizon port 80, following simplified naming convention is proposed: Kubernetes Namespace - openstack container providing OpenStack service - {service-name} The resulting name for keystone container would be "keystone.openstack" and all references to keystone in other services configuration files should be by its full name. 3. During the process of generating configuration files for services, use full dns names when referring toother services. Example is a resulting configuration to discover rabbitmq service. [oslo_messaging_rabbit] rabbit_hosts=rabbitmg.openstack:5672 Scope ----- The scope of this BP is to make use of existing dynamic dns functionality in Kubernetes and to introduce the service naming convention which should be followed while generating service configuration files. Security impact --------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Alternatives ------------ Use Kubernetes environment variables, they provide similar functionality but with less flexibility. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- TODO Milestones ---------- TODO Work Items ---------- 1. Agree upon the proposed service naming convention. 2. Establish procedure of testing dynamic DNS functionality of the Kubernetes cluster. 3. Make sure Service/Container Configuration generation tools follows established naming convention. Testing ======= These features can easily be tested in any test bed. Documentation Impact ==================== The documentation needs to be adjasted to reflect new features support. References ========== [1] http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/services/#discovering-services

commit_message:
[WIP] Condition and tags in requirements.yaml for keystone service

Use condition and tags feature for requirements.yaml in Helm 2.2 for
standalone keystone service installation
The dependency chart mariadb can be enabled/disabled upon user's choice.

Partially implements: blueprint condition-and-tags

commit_message:
Kube Util could not get api url from kubeconfig

Kube Util could not get api url from kubeconfig when cluster name is not
match with current-context

Current code flow will iterator each cluster in kube config, and then
find matched name with current context. The cluster's server could not
been found if cluster name is not match with current context. We should
find match context name instead cluster name, and then using context's
cluster name to find cluster. Finally get the cluster's server

Change-Id: Ia8a5004552e47e2216fe6413e0359a0df59a3d4e
Closed-Bug: 1669788
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/45/441145/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for context in configuration['contexts']: if context['name'] != current_context: continue context_cluster = context['context']['cluster'] for cluster in configuration['clusters']: if cluster['name'] == context_cluster: return cluster['cluster']['server']
deleted_lines: for cluster in configuration['clusters']: server = cluster['cluster']['server'] context = cluster['name'] if context == current_context: return server

commit_message:
Add --debug to all ceph workflows in gate

The ceph workflows lacked a --debug in helm output.  This doesn't
permit the display of the computed helm charts.  This is a
general improvement to the gate for consistency.

Change-Id: I9e5336f57365f885d2aaa408b76dec18c1d6eab5
Partially-Implements: blueprint gate-continuous-improvement

commit_message:
A start at a simplified devtool environment

We have wasted *TWO* months or more of time attempting to integrate
the development environment with the main gate.  Instead of doing
that, lets start small with a set of scripts based upon the
deployment guide which was built based upon learning how the
gate operates.

The intent is to follow this up with a gate specifically for the
development environment workflow.  I know this is far from perfect.
THe idea is for folks to build on this work in an incremental fashion.
As such, I'd ask for a little liency in the review process.

This will ultimatelly integrate with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457042/

Change-Id: I90671b4894f0024d3b094c8459edf61e1acfe04a
Partially-Implements: blueprint devenv-taketwo
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/75/457075/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: helm delete mariadb --purge & helm delete rabbitmq --purge & helm delete memcached --purge & helm delete keystone --purge & helm delete glance --purge & helm delete cinder-control --purge & helm delete horizon --purge & helm delete openvswitch --purge & helm delete neutron --purge & helm delete nova-control --purge & helm delete nova-compute --purge & sudo rm -rf /var/lib/kolla/volumes/*

commit_message:
WIP Fixing ironic deployment failure on Ubuntu

Due to some particularities of libvirtd on Ubuntu, it runs with nova user
privileges. It breaks virsh commands runing from the host.

Change-Id: Icb1db1000e02c2851f92ed76258e07a78863f897
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/03/449803/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: val=$(virsh_m list | grep $1 | awk '{print $3}') # # NOTE(sbezverk) Workaround for Ubuntu using user nova for libvirtd. Possibly can be removed # in Pike. sudo useradd -M --shell /usr/sbin/nologin --uid 42436 --gid 42436 nova alias virsh_m='sudo -u nova bash -c virsh' alias virsh_m='sudo virsh'virsh_m define $DIR/../conf/ironic/vm-1.xml virsh_m list --all
deleted_lines: val=$(sudo virsh list | grep $1 | awk '{print $3}')# # Debugging Ubuntu permission denied error # if [ "x$base_distro" == "xubuntu" ]; then sudo strace sudo virsh list --all sudo virsh define $DIR/../conf/ironic/vm-1.xml else sudo virsh define $DIR/../conf/ironic/vm-1.xml fi sudo virsh list --all

WIP: test2

Enable keepalived config generation

Change-Id: Idc745360598e6c4016666d874c10c17419256c68

commit_message:
WIP: Cache k8s

This PS caches the latest working Kubernetes software to insulate
the gate from sudden changes in the released binaries.

Change-Id: I2bd79073c66da24e57bf57a4e49ae2281a90b4df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/31/463331/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOGS="$1" DISTRO="$2" TYPE="$3" CONFIG="$4" BRANCH="$5" PIPELINE="$6" if [ "x$DISTRO" == "xcentos" ]; then sudo ls /var/cache/yum/x86_64/7/kubernetes/packages/ fi if [ "x$PIPELINE" == "xperiodic" -a "x$DISTRO" == "xcentos" ]; then fi

commit_message:
Playbook implements Deployment Guide

Playbook based on recent AIO Deployment Guide
-

Change-Id: I476517ff24bb68c4b422bfee2e375def52473b52
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/17/457317/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- - name: Get canal.yaml get_url: url: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/projectcalico/canal/master/k8s-install/kubeadm/1.6/canal.yaml dest: /tmp/canal.yaml mode: 0664 - name: Replace canal network IP replace: destfile: /tmp/canal.yaml regexp: '192.168.0.0' replace: '10.1.0.0' - name: Replace canal DNS IP replace: destfile: /tmp/canal.yaml regexp: '10.96.232.136' replace: '10.3.3.100' - name: Kubectl apply canal become: True become_user: ubuntu command: sudo kubectl apply -f /tmp/canal.yaml #curl -L https://raw.githubusercontent.com/projectcalico/canal/master/k8s-install/kubeadm/1.6/canal.yaml -o canal.yaml #sed -i "s@192.168.0.0/16@10.1.0.0/16@" canal.yaml #sed -i "s@10.96.232.136@10.3.3.100@" canal.yaml #kubectl apply -f canal.yaml

commit_message:
Change ordering of PV retrieval

In some conditions (such as service charts) the PVs are deleted
by the helm delete iteration.  To solve that, capture the list of
PVs after helm delete occurs.  This works for either service charts
or microchart deployments.

Change-Id: Ia7586c4c7b96c100f52ad682d21145fb654c72bd

commit_message:
Use labels in pv/pvc

Usage of labels in PV/PVCs permit binding PVCs to the intended
PV.

commit_message:
Add Apache License Content in index.rst

1. What is the problem?
Apache License 2.0 is lack in ./releasenotes/source/index.rst

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Add Apache License 2.0 Content which is necessary
for ./releasenotes/source/index.rst.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize the solution?
No need

commit_message:
Script to clean up kolla-kubernetes node labels

Since similar task seems very difficult to program in ansible,
I suggest to call this script right from the ansible destroy workflow
and enjoy the ride.

Change-Id: Icc3725dfdf1532c3d54e1d041700638bac7b5499

commit_message:
Remove kolla-ansible dependencies

Change-Id: I8f4d6336e6eec105160d626fd97e3ab68b17ce19
Closes-Bug: 1693281
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/67/467767/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # This script is meant to be run once after running start for the first # time. This script downloads a cirros image and registers it. Then it # configures networking and nova quotas to allow 40 m1.small instances # to be created. IMAGE_URL=http://download.cirros-cloud.net/0.3.5/ IMAGE=cirros-0.3.5-x86_64-disk.img IMAGE_NAME=cirros IMAGE_TYPE=linux EXT_NET_CIDR='10.0.2.0/24' EXT_NET_RANGE='start=10.0.2.150,end=10.0.2.199' EXT_NET_GATEWAY='10.0.2.1' # Sanitize language settings to avoid commands bailing out # with "unsupported locale setting" errors. unset LANG unset LANGUAGE LC_ALL=C export LC_ALL for i in curl openstack; do if [[ ! $(type ${i} 2>/dev/null) ]]; then if [ "${i}" == 'curl' ]; then echo "Please install ${i} before proceeding" else echo "Please install python-${i}client before proceeding" fi exit fi done # Move to top level directory REAL_PATH=$(python -c "import os,sys;print os.path.realpath('$0')") cd "$(dirname "$REAL_PATH")/.." # Test for credentials set if [[ "${OS_USERNAME}" == "" ]]; then echo "No Keystone credentials specified. Try running source openrc" exit fi # Test to ensure configure script is run only once if openstack image list | grep -q cirros; then echo "This tool should only be run once per deployment." exit fi echo Downloading glance image. if ! [ -f "${IMAGE}" ]; then curl -L -o ./${IMAGE} ${IMAGE_URL}/${IMAGE} fi echo Creating glance image. openstack image create --disk-format qcow2 --container-format bare --public \ --property os_type=${IMAGE_TYPE} --file ./${IMAGE} ${IMAGE_NAME} echo Configuring neutron. openstack network create --external --provider-physical-network physnet1 \ --provider-network-type flat public1 openstack subnet create --no-dhcp \ --allocation-pool ${EXT_NET_RANGE} --network public1 \ --subnet-range ${EXT_NET_CIDR} --gateway ${EXT_NET_GATEWAY} public1-subnet openstack network create --provider-network-type vxlan demo-net openstack subnet create --subnet-range 10.0.0.0/24 --network demo-net \ --gateway 10.0.0.1 --dns-nameserver 8.8.8.8 demo-subnet openstack router create demo-router openstack router add subnet demo-router demo-subnet openstack router set --external-gateway public1 demo-router # Get admin user and tenant IDs ADMIN_USER_ID=$(openstack user list | awk '/ admin / {print $2}') ADMIN_PROJECT_ID=$(openstack project list | awk '/ admin / {print $2}') ADMIN_SEC_GROUP=$(openstack security group list --project ${ADMIN_PROJECT_ID} | awk '/ default / {print $2}') # Sec Group Config openstack security group rule create --ingress --ethertype IPv4 \ --protocol icmp ${ADMIN_SEC_GROUP} openstack security group rule create --ingress --ethertype IPv4 \ --protocol tcp --dst-port 22 ${ADMIN_SEC_GROUP} # Open heat-cfn so it can run on a different host openstack security group rule create --ingress --ethertype IPv4 \ --protocol tcp --dst-port 8000 ${ADMIN_SEC_GROUP} openstack security group rule create --ingress --ethertype IPv4 \ --protocol tcp --dst-port 8080 ${ADMIN_SEC_GROUP} if [ ! -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub ]; then echo Generating ssh key. ssh-keygen -t rsa -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa fi if [ -r ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub ]; then echo Configuring nova public key and quotas. openstack keypair create --public-key ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub mykey fi # Increase the quota to allow 40 m1.small instances to be created # 40 instances openstack quota set --instances 40 ${ADMIN_PROJECT_ID} # 40 cores openstack quota set --cores 40 ${ADMIN_PROJECT_ID} # 96GB ram openstack quota set --ram 96000 ${ADMIN_PROJECT_ID} # add default flavors, if they don't already exist if ! openstack flavor list | grep -q m1.tiny; then openstack flavor create --id 1 --ram 512 --disk 1 --vcpus 1 m1.tiny openstack flavor create --id 2 --ram 2048 --disk 20 --vcpus 1 m1.small openstack flavor create --id 3 --ram 4096 --disk 40 --vcpus 2 m1.medium openstack flavor create --id 4 --ram 8192 --disk 80 --vcpus 4 m1.large openstack flavor create --id 5 --ram 16384 --disk 160 --vcpus 8 m1.xlarge fi DEMO_NET_ID=$(openstack network list | awk '/ demo-net / {print $2}') cat << EOF Done. To deploy a demo instance, run: openstack server create \\ --image ${IMAGE_NAME} \\ --flavor m1.tiny \\ --key-name mykey \\ --nic net-id=${DEMO_NET_ID} \\ demo1 EOF

commit_message:
(WIP) Deploy playbook testing with nova PV

Depends on this patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/471150

Change-Id: Ia04db6d030c110b5a854b3c60aabb7a65bd3c006
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/26/479826/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Create nova pv command: "helm install --debug ../helm/microservice/novainstances-pv --namespace kolla --name nova-pv --values /etc/kolla/cloud.yaml" when: cloud_config.global.kolla.all.pv_enabled is not defined or cloud_config.global.kolla.all.pv_enabled == true - name: Create nova pvc command: "helm install --debug ../helm/microservice/novainstances-pvc --namespace kolla --name nova-pvc --values /etc/kolla/cloud.yaml"

commit_message:
WIP: test rebooting in the gate

Change-Id: I6acd40d41ff9b4d6c3f9ca7fae6ecdde8844cb05
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/93/413193/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash -xe WORKSPACE="$1" LOGS="$2" NODES=1 cat /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private | while read line; do NODES=$((NODES+1)) echo $line tar -cvf - . | ssh $USER@$line 'cat > workspace.tar' ssh $USER@$line 'sudo reboot & exit' set +e START=$(date '+%s') while true; do ssh $USER@$line [ $? -eq 0 ] && break NOW=$(date '+%s') sleep 5 # 5 min wait. [ $NOW -ge $((START + 300)) ] && echo "Node didn't come back." && exit -1 done set -e done

commit_message:
Adjust instructions to successfully install pip

The package "python-pip" is not available prior to installing epel-release.

Closes-Bug: #1716605

Change-Id: I039b306dbf26cadd7771862b853a64b123a5e749
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/60/502960/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: sudo yum install -y epel-release ansible python-pip python-devel

commit_message:
Specify cloud.yaml instead of cloud.yml in docs

The docs mostly standardize on cloud.yaml but there is one instance
of a cloud.yml which is incorrect.

Change-Id: I4a3b31f9fc776ec369ab336ab8b7591945580b4a

deleted_lines: Create a local cloud.yml file for the deployment of the charts:: cat <<EOF > cloud.yml

subject: Support for increasing thread cache size in TCMalloc.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-16 03:17:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes/commit/90af7957420971be7fe6b1ae8ba30e1b18ffd319', 'message': "Support for increasing thread cache size in TCMalloc.

Currently TCMalloc's default tc size is 32MB.
This causes poor performance in ceph storage.
A new ceph_tcmalloc_tc_bytes option has been added
with a default of 128MB.

128 MB is default TC size at above jewel version.
and if we don't set this config,
osd daemon will running with 32 MB.
because 32MB is default size in TCmalloc 2.4 version.
32MB and 128MB are twice the performance difference.
- reference : https://www.slideshare.net/Red_Hat_Storage/
ceph-performance-projects-leading-up-to-jewel-61050682

Closes-Bug: #1698249

commit_message:
Support for increasing thread cache size in TCMalloc.

Currently TCMalloc's default tc size is 32MB.
This causes poor performance in ceph storage.
A new ceph_tcmalloc_tc_bytes option has been added
with a default of 128MB.

128 MB is default TC size at above jewel version.
and if we don't set this config,
osd daemon will running with 32 MB.
because 32MB is default size in TCmalloc 2.4 version.
32MB and 128MB are twice the performance difference.
- reference : https://www.slideshare.net/Red_Hat_Storage/
ceph-performance-projects-leading-up-to-jewel-61050682

Closes-Bug: #1698249
Change-Id: I85f87c9b859c7ee4d3dfd3eade98896b24f1139a
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>

commit_message:
Deploy playbook using microservices

Add a deploy playbook that uses only microcharts to bring up services.

Change-Id: Ife49568a95049dff55a8b656547818dd5ca8509d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/88/473588/33 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- - name: Create Physical Volume command: "helm install --debug ../helm/microservice/rabbitmq-pv --namespace kolla --name rabbitmq-pv --values /etc/kolla/cloud.yaml" - name: Create Physical Volume Claim command: "helm install --debug ../helm/microservice/rabbitmq-pvc --namespace kolla --name rabbitmq-pvc --values /etc/kolla/cloud.yaml" - name: Create Service command: "helm install --debug ../helm/microservice/rabbitmq-svc --namespace kolla --name rabbitmq-svc --values /etc/kolla/cloud.yaml" - name: Start init job command: "helm install --debug ../helm/microservice/rabbitmq-init-element-job --namespace kolla --name rabbitmq-init-element-job --values /etc/kolla/cloud.yaml" - name: Start rabbitmq command: "helm install --debug ../helm/microservice/rabbitmq-statefulset --namespace kolla --name rabbitmq --values /etc/kolla/cloud.yaml"

writing convention: do not use -y for package install

Adhering to coding conventions. Refer to ``Code conventions`` at
https://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/ for details

commit_message:
Fix hostname in rabbitmq-clusterer.config

The hostname is determined when generating config files using
kolla-ansible, so it need to be replaced with one in /etc/hosts of a
rabbitmq container.

Change-Id: I1934b6b1c62330dde467b16705368c3b14fd4378
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/21/518321/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sed -i 's/\(rabbit@\)\([[:alnum:]_-]*\)/\1'$HOSTNAME'/' /srv/pod-main-config/rabbitmq-clusterer.config

commit_message:
WIP Dockerfile to run ansible orchiestration

When we move to ansible orchiestration, we want it to run on k8s.
That means we need container with it.

Change-Id: I02bc0bc314ed29fae172cea189d064b4bbd2ff76

commit_message:
Helm Native Values Step 2.

This PS converts most of the rest of all_values.yaml
to helm parent values stored in the kolla-common chart.

Change-Id: I773c9e0310beb55939625e5a8e3dc13d462ef768
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/83/506383/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - nova-novncproxy-port

subject: Helm Native Values Step 1.

commit_message:
Helm Native Values Step 1.

This PS starts converting away from generating microservices
values.yaml to building it using the helm native parent
values feature.

Change-Id: Ieac62538662fc267bb42e2c795a05bdd8d8e3120

commit_message:
Make registry available

This will be required for more advanced orch work - putting ansible in
containers. Also first step to move gates to tarball-based images.

Change-Id: Ic75b81efd365a3d1fcd2fc658f4798cc5edd6d48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/99/489299/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tools/setup_registry.sh $DISTRO $TYPE $BRANCH sed -i 's/install_type.*/install_type: source/g' helm/all_values.yaml

WIP: Initial stab at ceph dynamic provisioning support.

Change-Id: Ie40b5b8393fe0f28641f5ee7301249cb6e4d6d2d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/51/493651/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: str="grep 'key =' /etc/ceph/ceph.client.admin.keyring | awk '{print "'$3'"}'" kubectl exec ceph-admin -c main --namespace=kolla -- /bin/bash -c \ "$str" > /tmp/$$ cat /tmp/$$ key=$(cat /tmp/$$) git clone https://github.com/kfox1111/charts/ cd charts git checkout -b ceph-provisioner origin/ceph-provisioner helm install stable/ceph-provisioner --set adminSecret.key=$key,userSecret.name=admin,adminSecret.key=$key cd ..

commit_message:
WIP: Add support for HTTPS on external API network

This patch enables the use of HTTPS for the OpenStack API by
using HAProxy to provide TLS termination.  Both the configuration
and the documentation for the deployment guide are updated with
this optional feature.

This patch is still in progress.

Next step is to update the Keystone catalog entries with https://
instead of http:// for those services presenting with TLS.

For the initial patch, only the services that currently use
HAProxy will support TLS.

Co-Authored-By: Kevin Fox <kevin@efox.cc>

Change-Id: I2ee6a379c424b2aaa7780dc412211496afe8f5b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/92/471992/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: KEYSTONE_USE_HTTPS=`grep "^kolla_enable_tls_external:" /etc/kolla/globals.yml \ | cut -d':' -f2 | sed -e 's/ //' | sed -e 's/"//g'` if [ "$KEYSTONE_USE_HTTPS" == "yes" ]; then KEYSTONE_PROTOCOL="https" CACERT="/etc/kolla/certificates/haproxy-ca.crt" else KEYSTONE_PROTOCOL="http" fi export OS_AUTH_URL=$KEYSTONE_PROTOCOL://$KEYSTONE_CLUSTER_IP:$KEYSTONE_CLUSTER_PORT/v3export OS_CACERT=$CACERT

commit_message:
Simple configmap to raw kubectl

Generate simple configmaps using just kubectl. This removes
most of the remaining uses of kollakube.

Change-Id: I98984be44e53cc24faedba53844785cd0b2080a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/62/449262/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for cm in nova-scheduler glance-api \ nova-novncproxy \ cinder-api cinder-backup \ ironic-api ironic-conductor ironic-dnsmasq \ ironic-inspector ironic-pxe; do kubectl create configmap $cm --from-file=/etc/kolla/$cm --namespace kolla; done kollakube res create configmap \ glance-api-haproxy glance-registry-haproxy nova-api-haproxy \ nova-novncproxy-haproxy neutron-server-haproxy cinder-api-haproxy \ ironic-api-haproxy ironic-inspector-haproxy
deleted_lines: kollakube res create configmap \ nova-scheduler glance-api-haproxy glance-registry-haproxy glance-api \ nova-novncproxy nova-novncproxy-haproxy neutron-server-haproxy \ nova-api-haproxy cinder-api cinder-api-haproxy cinder-backup \ ironic-api ironic-api-haproxy ironic-conductor ironic-dnsmasq \ ironic-inspector ironic-inspector-haproxy ironic-pxe;

commit_message:
Remove development environment

Halcyon is not actively maintained.  As a result, we need a
different approach to a development environment.  This first
step removes the existing unmaintained development environment.

Change-Id: Ib668ee372add42a43152252d993f8eaed0ddb261
Partially-Implements: blueprint devenv-taketwo
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/63/456963/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/bin/bash -xe TMP_BUILD_DIR=/tmp/kolla-kubernetes-build DEV_BASE=~/devel BUILD_ARGS="--tag kolla/k8s-devenv:latest" # Set the below environment variables if you are running behind a proxy if [ ! "x$http_proxy" == "x" ]; then BUILD_ARGS="$BUILD_ARGS --build-arg http_proxy=$http_proxy" fi if [ ! "x$https_proxy" == "x" ]; then BUILD_ARGS="$BUILD_ARGS --build-arg https_proxy=$https_proxy" fi # Set the below environment variable if your dev base is not ~/devel if [ ! "x$dev_path" == "x" ]; then DEV_BASE = $dev_path fi # delete old build environment if it is still there cleanup_build_dir () { if [ -d ${TMP_BUILD_DIR} ]; then rm -rf ${TMP_BUILD_DIR} fi } # create build environment and run do_build () { if [ ! -d ${TMP_BUILD_DIR} ]; then mkdir ${TMP_BUILD_DIR} mkdir ${TMP_BUILD_DIR}/repos fi HALCYON_TMP=${TMP_BUILD_DIR}/repos/halcyon-vagrant-kubernetes cp ${DEV_BASE}/kolla-kubernetes/tools/Dockerfile ${TMP_BUILD_DIR} cp -R ${DEV_BASE}/kolla-kubernetes ${TMP_BUILD_DIR}/repos/ cp -R ${DEV_BASE}/kolla-ansible ${TMP_BUILD_DIR}/repos/ cp -R ${DEV_BASE}/halcyon-vagrant-kubernetes ${TMP_BUILD_DIR}/repos/ pushd ${HALCYON_TMP} vagrant ssh-config > ssh-config sed -ie "s/\/tmp\/kolla-kubernetes-build\/repos\/halcyon-vagrant-kubernetes/\/opt\/halcyon-vagrant-kubernetes/g" ssh-config cp -R ~/.kube ${TMP_BUILD_DIR}/kube cd ${TMP_BUILD_DIR}; docker build ${BUILD_ARGS} . } cleanup_build_dir do_build

commit_message:
WIP memcached operator

python based operator for memcached, includes 3 major components:
1. Kubernetes 3rd party object, which define MemcachedOperator kind
2. Kubernetes definition of memcached-operator. This object allows
   communication between some entity controlling entity, could be
   a human operator or some orchestration and memcached-operator
   executing agent.
3. Python script of memcached-operator execution agent. It monitors
   changes in the state of memcached-operator object and reacts
   accordingly.

Change-Id: Icbe68245e8ffc68a1617047c5aa34915d2404681

added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import argparse import json import urllib2 import os.path import os import subprocess import sys import yaml import uuid helm_port = '8879' operator_namespace = 'kolla' class KubernetesCluster(object): def __init__(self, name): self.name = name self.token = self.load_token() self.dialString = self.build_dial_string() def load_token(self): token = '' try: with open('/var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token', 'r') as f: token = f.read() except (OSError, IOError): pass return token def build_dial_string(self): dial_string = 'https://{}:{}/api/'.format(os.environ["KUBERNETES_SERVICE_HOST"],os.environ["KUBERNETES_PORT_443_TCP_PORT"]) return dial_string def add_helm_repo(): command_line = "helm repo add --debug helm-repo http://helm-repo:{}".format( helm_port) try: res = subprocess.check_output( command_line, shell=True, executable='/bin/bash') except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: return 1 return 0 def generate_label(): ''' generate unique label used for operator to identify object belonging to it. ''' label = str(uuid.uuid4())[-12:] return label def install_microservice(microservice_name,microservice_version,operator_namespace='kolla'): microservice_url = "http://helm-repo:{}/{}-{}.tgz".format( helm_port, microservice_name, microservice_version) print(microservice_url) return 0 def check_object_status(object_kind, label, wait_time=120): return 0 def main(): if add_helm_repo() != 0: raise SystemExit('Failed to add helm-repo to the list. Exiting...') label = generate_label() label = '24ac7811240b' cluster = KubernetesCluster('kube-1') print('Retrieved token: ',cluster.token) print('Dial string: ',cluster.dialString) install_microservice("memcached-svc","3.0.0-1",operator_namespace='kolla') object_kind = 'svc' if check_object_status(object_kind, label) != 0: raise SystemExit('Failed to create kubernetes object. Exiting...') if __name__ == '__main__': sys.exit(main())

Seperate kolla and kolla-ansible search paths

Add method to find  kolla-ansible path
Add dictionary variable for ymls
Add array variable for roles
Fix variable name from kolla_dir to kolla_ansible_dir

Remove unneeded config overrides.

Not all config overrides are needed in all nova services. This
removes the dead code.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I841a1ceef2ae5c91fedd0783fca7a0e02977686b

commit_message:
Remove all -1 from setup_gate.sh

-1 is not something bash returns.  Instead return a nonzero
value > 0 as per POSIX standards.

Change-Id: I59b2e7de605ddce9adaa6caadd2238dffe207d1c

commit_message:
[WIP] Updated Pods and RCs to Deployments

- Replication Controllers have been updated to Deployments
- Pods have been converted to Deployments with labels and
  selectors added

Change-Id: I78b0ccb0201dc5c4232166a68cd186d520380ed3
Partially-implements: blueprint deployments

commit_message:
Document globals and fix val logic to match.

This PS adds documentation for the globals for both
users and developers and updates the macro to follow
it.

Partially-Implements: blueprint helm-microservices
Change-Id: I064a74fd28c9553942baf1f2bafa053fe7bd7d99
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/65/414665/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. devel-values: ======================================= Kolla Kubernetes Developer Values Guide ======================================= There are some values we define commonly that need to be consistently used in the project. Common values ============= * $serviceName - Short name for the service. For nova-api, it is nova * $serviceType - Short type for the service. For nova-api, it is api. It is optional for simple services. * $serviceKind - Short kind for the service. For nova-api, it is deployment. * $elementName - Short name for the element. Should always be set to .Values.element_name | default $serviceName * $elementType - Short type for the element. Should always be set to .Values.element_type | default $serviceType

subject: Support rolling upgrades of horizon
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-24 16:57:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes/commit/473c41010de420350d52594ace4f702ea88219c2', 'message': 'Horizon Versioning

Horizon is a web application that is distributed between the web
server, and the web browser. If the web server is upgraded while
the application is still running on the web browser, unusual issues
can creep up.

This patch allows multiple versions of Horizon to be run on
Kubernetes in parallel. Further patches will use this to direct
existing browser sessions at the version of Horizon they started on
to allow seamless major rolling upgrades.

Change-Id: Ib1d840aa10f02dfec6c89b7fa8a4fcf0ea204994
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-24 17:19:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes/commit/adda9c72f6355feb78ce48b946ccb4bd32a81d13', 'message': 'Horizon Versioning

commit_message:
Support rolling upgrades of horizon

Horizon is a web application that is distributed between the web
server, and the web browser. If the web server is upgraded while
the application is still running on the web browser, unusual issues
can creep up.

This patch set allows multiple versions of Horizon to be run on
Kubernetes in parallel. It adds a Horizon frontend with session
tracking that allows the browser to continue to use the Horizon
version it was started with.

Change-Id: Ib1d840aa10f02dfec6c89b7fa8a4fcf0ea204994

commit_message:
Local registry in gate for trunk builds

This PS adds trunk support to the gate, as well as local repo
caching for trunk.

Co-Authored-By: Kevin Fox <Kevin.Fox@pnnl.gov>

Change-Id: I6d33b7caa0faff37df3696196fdf588f7c633a6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/50/418550/64 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: registry = 127.0.0.1:4000 push = true function setup_registry { filename=${BASE_DISTRO}-${INSTALL_TYPE}-${ZUUL_BRANCH}-registry.tar.gz wget -q -c -O /tmp/$filename \ http://tarballs.openstack.org/kolla/images/$filename sudo mkdir /tmp/kolla_registry sudo chmod -R 644 /tmp/kolla_registry sudo tar xzf /tmp/$filename -C /tmp/kolla_registry docker run -d -p 4000:5000 --restart=always -v /tmp/kolla_registry/:/var/lib/registry --name registry registry:2 } setup_registry docker pull 127.0.0.1:4000/kolla/ubuntu-source-base:4.0.0

commit_message:
Add ansible-org gates

new gates based on master images

Change-Id: Iae91c053a399d2a9ddbce579576e877c98f23b8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/16/531516/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- - project: name: openstack/kolla-ansible check: jobs: - kolla-k8s-ansible-centos-source-master - nodeset: name: kolla-k8s-centos nodes: - name: primary label: centos-7 - name: node1 label: centos-7 - name: node2 label: centos-7 - job: name: kolla-k8s-base pre-run: tests/playbooks/pre.yml run: tests/playbooks/run.yml post-run: tests/playbooks/post.yml attempts: 1 timeout: 5400 required-projects: - openstack/kolla - openstack/requirements irrelevant-files: - ^.*\.rst$ - ^doc/.* - job: name: kolla-k8s-ansible-centos-source-master parent: kolla-k8s-base nodeset: kolla-k8s-centos vars: base_distro: centos install_type: source

subject: Ingress rolling upgrade support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-27 16:32:10.000000000', 'files': ['helm/kolla-common/templates/_common_api_python_deployment.yaml', 'helm/kolla-common/templates/_common_api_apache_deployment.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes/commit/013f1c0ff8bbae133e4606e6fa330c6dadb0f873', 'message': 'Ingress rolling upgrade support

This ps makes rolling upgrades follow the advice given by the nginx
ingress documentation here:
https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress/issues/322#issuecomment-298016539

Change-Id: Ia2dbc4b95b008f2ec5b0ef5804a83bcf56975076
'}]
commit_message:
Ingress rolling upgrade support

This ps makes rolling upgrades follow the advice given by the nginx
ingress documentation here:
https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress/issues/322#issuecomment-298016539

Change-Id: Ia2dbc4b95b008f2ec5b0ef5804a83bcf56975076
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/12/478212/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - /bin/bash - -c - 'sleep 15; apachectl -k graceful-stop'

commit_message:
Update deployment instructions

The kolla-kubernetes deployment instructions
at present needed a revision w.r.t.

1. Canal CNI Driver version
2. kubectl instructions for deployment of RBAC settings

Change-Id: Id2d214dd8414e216c40a72edfabb523492250b1f
Signed-off-by: Swapnil Kulkarni <me@coolsvap.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/69/540869/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: curl -L https://raw.githubusercontent.com/projectcalico/canal/master/k8s-install/1.6/rbac.yaml -o rbac.yaml curl -L https://raw.githubusercontent.com/projectcalico/canal/master/k8s-install/1.6/canal.yaml -o canal.yaml kubectl update -f <(cat <<EOF apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1alpha1

commit_message:
Kubernetes Operator base

This patch includes:
  Base Kubernetes Operator class - kubernetes-operator.
  Base Service Kubernetes Operator class - service-operator.
  Kubernetes Operator Controller

The Kubernetes Operator container will execute the Controller
script consuming the yaml file 'operator.yaml'. 'operator.yaml'
will describe how the operator will run.

Change-Id: Ibbc9719455aa1d76a655fe73d22720ab765d191b
Partially-implements: blueprint operator-base

"""Service Operator class.""" import subprocess from kubernetes_operator import Operator class ServiceOperator(Operator): def __init__(self, data): self.data = data super(ServiceOperator, self).__init__(data) def _database_action(self): """ Register an OpenStack service's user and password in the database """ print "does nothing" def _keystone_action(self): """ Register a service user and role in Keystone """ print "does nothing" def _run_helm_package(self): """ Execute a Helm package for a service """ print "does nothing"

commit_message:
Implment swift bootstrap job

Change-Id: I6bd9ef22e340a43afe8078c6001cd2b46d505731
Partially-implements: blueprint openstack-services
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/16/320316/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: apiVersion: batch/v1 kind: Job spec: template: metadata: name: swift-bootstrap spec: hostNetwork: True containers: - image: "{{ kolla_toolbox_image_full }}" #- image: kolla_toolbox name: register-endpoints command: - /usr/bin/ansible - localhost - -m kolla_keystone_service - -a "service_name=swift service_type=object-store description='Openstack Object Storage' endpoint_region={{ openstack_region_name }} url='{{ item.url }}' interface='{{ item.interface }}' region_name={{ openstack_region_name }} auth={{ '{{ openstack_swift_auth }}' }}" - -e "{'openstack_swift_auth':{{ openstack_swift_auth }}}" - image: "{{ kolla_toolbox_image_full }}" #- image: kolla_toolbox name: setup-user-database command: - /usr/bin/ansible - localhost - -m kolla_keystone_user - -a "project=service user={{ swift_keystone_user }} password={{ swift_keystone_password }} role={{ swift_admin_tenant_name }} region_name={{ openstack_region_name }} auth={{ '{{ openstack_swift_auth }}' }}" - -e "{'openstack_swift_auth':{{ openstack_swift_auth }}}" - image: "{{ kolla_toolbox_image_full }}" #- image: kolla_toolbox name: disk-lookup command: - /usr/bin/ansible - localhost - -m find_disks - -a "name={{ swift_devices_name }} match_mode={{ swift_devices_match_mode }}" restartPolicy: OnFailure metadata: name: swift-bootstrap

commit_message:
Fencing pod

This PS introduces fencing pod which:
1. Checks for status of kubernetes nodes
2. in case of a node failure it:
   2.1 Cleans CEPH locks
   2.2 Poweroff failed node via IPMI
   2.3 Clean up all Terminating PODs for faster failover

Change-Id: Iac47af9c9040f1128f0e5dbbb56bddbbaa15ecab
PartiallyImplements: blueprint kubernetes-toolbox
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/22/383922/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {%- set resourceName = kolla_kubernetes.cli.args.resource_name %} {%- import "services/common/common-lib.yml.j2" as lib with context %} apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1 kind: Deployment metadata: name: fencing namespace: {{ kolla_kubernetes_namespace }} spec: replicas: {{ fencing_replicas | default(1) }} template: metadata: labels: service: fencing spec: nodeSelector: {%- set selector = kolla_kubernetes_hostlabel_controller %} {{ selector.key }}: {{ selector.value }} containers: - name: main image: "192.168.80.240:4000/kolla/centos-source-kubetoolbox:3.0.0" volumeMounts: {{ lib.common_volume_mounts(indent=12) }} - mountPath: {{ container_config_directory }} name: pod-main-config - mountPath: /tmp name: pod-tmp command: [ "sh","-c"," {%- if storage_ceph['secretName'] is defined %} modprobe rbd; mkdir -p /etc/ceph; echo $CEPH_PASSWORD >> {{ storage_ceph['keyring'] }}; {% endif %} {%- if ipmi_secret is defined %} {% endif %} while true; do echo 'Collecting currently Ready nodes'; kubectl get nodes | grep Ready | awk '{print $1}' > /tmp/ready-node-names; echo 'Removing Ready nodes from the list of not ready nodes'; for node in `cat /tmp/ready-node-names`; do echo $node' - became ready, removing it from notready list' rm -f /tmp/$node; done; echo 'Collecting currently NotReady nodes'; kubectl get nodes | grep NotReady | awk '{print $1}' > /tmp/notready-node-names; echo 'Cheking nodes in not ready list'; for node in `cat /tmp/notready-node-names`; do if [ ! -a /tmp/$node ]; then echo $node' - just has become NotReady, adding it to notready list'; touch /tmp/$node; {%- if storage_ceph['secretName'] is defined %} {% endif %} {%- if ipmi_secret is defined %} {% endif %} fi; done; echo 'Checking for Terminating containers'; if [ $(wc -l < /tmp/notready-node-names) -gt 0 ]; then kubectl get pods --namespace={{ kolla_kubernetes_namespace }} | grep Terminating | awk '{print $1}' > /tmp/pods-names; while read pod; do echo 'Killing '$pod' since it is in Terminating state'; kubectl delete pods $pod --now --namespace={{ kolla_kubernetes_namespace }}; done < /tmp/pods-names; fi; echo 'Now sleep'; sleep 5; done; "] env: - name: KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY value: {{ config_strategy }} {%- if ipmi_secret is defined %} - name: IPMI_PASSWORD valueFrom: secretKeyRef: name: {{ ipmiSecret }} key: password {% endif %} {%- if storage_ceph['secretName'] is defined %} - name: CEPH_PASSWORD valueFrom: secretKeyRef: name: {{ storage_ceph['secretName'] }} key: key {% endif %} volumes: {{ lib.common_volumes(indent=8) }} - name: pod-main-config emptyDir: {} - name: service-configmap configMap: name: fencing - name: pod-tmp emptyDir: {}

commit_message:
Helm charts for heat/heat-cfn create user and endpoints.

Add heat-create-keystone-endpoint-admin
    heat-create-keystone-endpoint-internal
    heat-create-keystone-endpoint-public
    heat-create-keystone-service
    heat-cfn-create-keystone-endpoint-admin
    heat-cfn-create-keystone-endpoint-internal
    heat-cfn-create-keystone-endpoint-public
    heat-cfn-create-keystone-service
    heat-create-keystone-user
Partially implements the heat.

Co-Authored-By: Balaji G Pattewar <balaji.pattewar@oracle.com>

Change-Id: I59d48ac37dd657394c92b3578505dfdd149ae21e
Partially-Implements: blueprint helm-microservices

added_lines: {{- $resourceName := "heat-create-keystone-endpoint-internal" }} {{- $netHostTrue := false }} {{- $podTypeBootstrap := true }} {{- $serviceName := "heat" }} {{- $serviceType := "orchestration" }} {{- $interface := "internal" }} {{- $heatInternalEndpointBuilt := printf "http://%s:%1.f/v1/%%(tenant_id)s" .Values.heat_internal_service .Values.heat_api_port }} {{- $endpointURLFull := .Values.heat_internal_endpoint | default $heatInternalEndpointBuilt }} {{- with $env := dict "netHostTrue" $netHostTrue "podTypeBootstrap" $podTypeBootstrap "resourceName" $resourceName "serviceName" $serviceName "serviceType" $serviceType "interface" $interface "endpointURLFull" $endpointURLFull "Release" .Release "Values" .Values }} {{- include "common_create_keystone_endpoint" $env }} {{- end }}
