commit_message:
Pull container tallballs into the gate

Pull containers from tarballs.oo to make gate more reliable.

This patch works by downloading the regitry from tarballs.oo, then
using the docker load operation to instantiate the tarballs.  Note
we use wget in this patch instead of curl as wget is far more reliable.

Depends-On: I7dcb6b2a8faf1ce74e10f73f6465f4c693031990
Change-Id: Ibc92755f20c4f4fcc1a0e13d7b2d58967a9dd5e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/98/426598/34 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ "x$PIPELINE" != "xperiodic" ]; then mkdir -p $WORKSPACE/DOWNLOAD_CONTAINERS BASE_URL=http://tarballs.openstack.org/kolla-kubernetes/gate/containers/ FILENAME="$DISTRO-$TYPE-$CONFIG" FILENAME=$(echo "$FILENAME" | sed 's/-multi/') curl -o $WORKSPACE/DOWNLOAD_CONTAINERS/"$FILENAME".tar.bz2 \ "$BASE_URL/$FILENAME.tar.bz2" curl -o $WORKSPACE/DOWNLOAD_CONTAINERS/"$FILENAME"-containers.txt \ "$BASE_URL/$FILENAME-containers.txt" curl -o $WORKSPACE/DOWNLOAD_CONTAINERS/kubernetes.tar.bz2 \ "$BASE_URL/kubernetes.tar.bz2" curl -o $WORKSPACE/DOWNLOAD_CONTAINERS/kubernetes-containers.txt \ "$BASE_URL/kubernetes-containers.txt" fi scp -r "$WORKSPACE/DOWNLOAD_CONTAINERS" $line:

commit_message:
Massive rework of the kolla-kubernetes docs

- Organize all the docs in an order that is easlier to read
- Shorten the quickstart and make AIO the default deployment
- Multinode will be considered 'advanced deployment'
- Remove unused docs

Change-Id: I544cbb422277b1dd3c3fecdfef67c496f92975d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/67/362467/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. kubernetes-setup: ====================== Kubernetes Setup Guide ====================== There are many options in existance for setting up Kubernetes. These guides are meant for developers and operators who want to use the same tools the community is using to setup Kubernetes. The guides are based off of existing tools in the Kubernetes community. Setting up Kubernetes is **optional** if you have an operational Kubernetes cluster version of 1.3 or greater. The community recommends new developers trying out a single node deployment of kolla-kubernetes to start with. .. include:: kubernetes-single-node.rst .. include:: kubernetes-multinode.rst

commit_message:
WIP: prototype multiversion/release support

This PS proposes a way to make it easy to support easily maintaining version numbers,
quick releases and supporting both 2.0.2 and 3.0.1 for the gate.

Change-Id: I43f34d90cbe3c48b003e904d2f420c25b320fc61
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/69/409569/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cliff import argparse if res != "": print(res)def _version_override(version, revisions, microdir, package): chartfile = os.path.join(microdir, package, "Chart.yaml") file = open(chartfile, 'r') chart = yaml.load(file) file.close() revision = revisions.get(package, revisions['common']) chart['version'] = "%s-%s" % (version, revision) file = open(chartfile, 'w') file.write("%s" % yaml.safe_dump(chart, default_flow_style=False)) file.close() parser = argparse.ArgumentParser( description='', add_help=True ) version_override = False parser.add_argument( '-v', '--version', type=str, help="Override the version to build" ) options, remainder = parser.parse_known_args(sys.argv) revisions = {} if options.version: revisionsfile = open(os.path.join(srcdir, 'versions', "%s_revisions.yaml" % options.version), "r") revisions = yaml.load(revisionsfile) revisionsfile.close() vervaluesfile = open(os.path.join(srcdir, 'versions', "%s_all_values.yaml" % options.version), "r") vervalues = yaml.load(vervaluesfile) vervaluesfile.close() values.update(vervalues) values = yaml.load(open(os.path.join(srcdir, "all_values.yaml"))) for package in [p for p in microservices if _isdir(microdir, p)]: if options.version: _version_override(options.version, revisions, microdir, package)
deleted_lines: print(res) for package in [p for p in microservices if _isdir(microdir, p)]:

commit_message:
Add mandatory field to deployment document

For whatever reason, port must be specified for keystone.all in order
for cell0 registration to work.

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ic1b777cf7d665615dce8efe3a96235f9162fc3bb
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/30/555630/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:lower-constraints] basepython = python3 deps = -c{toxinidir}/lower-constraints.txt -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt -r{toxinidir}/requirements.txt

commit_message:
Update home-page url

The url of home-page is out of date. We need update it.

Change-Id: I6062a5a270fc53edb7ff1f4eaa8358c4c5f3cd69

    WSGI configuration is missing the directive
    "WSGIApplicationGroup %{GLOBAL}" after
    WSGIProcessGroup" in the horizon template.
    Of all WSGI configuration templates it is
    the only one that does not have the

    Closes-Bug: #1759488

commit_message:
WSGI configuration missing directive

    WSGI configuration is missing the directive
    "WSGIApplicationGroup %{GLOBAL}" after
    WSGIProcessGroup" in the horizon template.
    Of all WSGI configuration templates it is
    the only one that does not have the
    "WSGIApplicationGroup" line.

    Closes-Bug: #1759488

Change-Id: Iccae0ddc00dffdb122aabca151f62c035a7b6f91
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/63/557163/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: WSGIApplicationGroup %{GLOBAL}

subject: Enable to use HA Kubernetes masters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-29 09:31:53.000000000', 'files': ['helm/microservice/haproxy-daemonset/templates/haproxy-daemonset.yaml', 'helm/service/haproxy/Chart.yaml', 'helm/microservice/keepalived-daemonset/templates/keepalived-daemonset.yaml', 'helm/microservice/haproxy-daemonset/Chart.yaml', 'helm/microservice/haproxy-daemonset/requirements.yaml', 'helm/service/haproxy/requirements.yaml', 'services/haproxy/haproxy-configmap.yml.j2', 'helm/all_values.yaml', 'etc/kolla-kubernetes/service_resources.yml', 'etc/kolla-kubernetes/kolla-kubernetes.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes/commit/5257b2bc31e3dab86edf8334fc9f8e8e10dec95c', 'message': 'Enable to use HA Kubernetes masters

In the case of adding new k8s master replicas to an existing k8s cluster
for HA, a load balancer and reverse proxy need to be set up.
Run these helm charts which install Keepalived using a VIP contained in
'kolla_internal_vip_address' and reverse proxy for all services of
kolla-k8s, after configuring some files below.
cloud.yaml
- Assigning VIP to "external_vip" and "dns_name"
/etc/kolla/global.yml
- Assigning VIP to "kolla_internal_vip_address"
- configure "api_interfase"
/etc/kolla-kubernetes/kolla-kubernetes.yml
- Assigning VIP to "kolla_kubernetes_external_vip"
- Assigning IPs of master replicas to "kolla_kubernetes_masters"
- Enable "HAProxy variables"
kolla-kubernetes/helm/all_values.yml
- Assigning VIP to "kolla_kubernetes_external_vip"
Enable binding to non-local IP addresses
$ echo "net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind=1" >> /etc/sysctl.conf
$ sysctl -p

The final step is to configure k8s for HA, e.g. configuring the reverse
proxy for kube-api, clustering etcd servers and so on(The full details
are beyond the scope of kolla-k8s, Refer to the following section
for further details: https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/high-availability/)).

You can install these helm charts without additional k8s master replicas
and configuring k8s for HA for a test.

Change-Id: Id1a3fb29c1822b40f4f55ad05b8699018cd44836
Partially-Implements: blueprint set-up-ha
'}]
commit_message:
Enable to use HA Kubernetes masters

In the case of adding new k8s master replicas to an existing k8s cluster
for HA, a load balancer and reverse proxy need to be set up.
Run these helm charts which install Keepalived using a VIP contained in
'kolla_internal_vip_address' and reverse proxy for all services of
kolla-k8s, after configuring some files below.
cloud.yaml
- Assigning VIP to "external_vip" and "dns_name"
/etc/kolla/global.yml
- Assigning VIP to "kolla_internal_vip_address"
- configure "api_interfase"
/etc/kolla-kubernetes/kolla-kubernetes.yml
- Assigning VIP to "kolla_kubernetes_external_vip"
- Assigning IPs of master replicas to "kolla_kubernetes_masters"
- Enable "HAProxy variables"
kolla-kubernetes/helm/all_values.yml
- Assigning VIP to "kolla_kubernetes_external_vip"
Enable binding to non-local IP addresses
$ echo "net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind=1" >> /etc/sysctl.conf
$ sysctl -p

The final step is to configure k8s for HA, e.g. configuring the reverse
proxy for kube-api, clustering etcd servers and so on(The full details
are beyond the scope of kolla-k8s, Refer to the following section
for further details: https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/high-availability/)).

You can install these helm charts without additional k8s master replicas
and configuring k8s for HA for a test.

Change-Id: Id1a3fb29c1822b40f4f55ad05b8699018cd44836
Partially-Implements: blueprint set-up-ha
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/54/538854/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ######################################## # Allow to use HA Kubernetes Masters ######################################## # If HA Kubernetes masters are aleady set up, in other words, a external IP for # a master cluster is assigned and a reverse proxy for kube-api is installed, # all you need to do are to configure the reverse proxy for all services to # the reverse proxy and apply the VIP to some variables # # If not, you need to add master replicas yourself and install Keepalived for VIP # and reverse proxy for all services using haproxy helm charts. # And the next step is to configure k8s for HA, e.g. configuring the reverse proxy # for kube-api, clustering etcd servers and so on (The full details are beyond # the scope of kolla-k8s, Refer to the following section for further details: # https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/high-availability/)). # #kolla_kubernetes_masters: #- "10.57.120.200" #- "10.57.120.201" ###################### # HAProxy variables ######################## #haproxy_client_timeout: "1m" #haproxy_server_timeout: "1m" # #haproxy_glance_api_client_timeout: "6h" #haproxy_glance_api_server_timeout: "6h"

commit_message:
Kolla Kubernetes Service Exposure BP

The scope of this BP is to ensure that OpenStack services
are accessible to outside users.

Change-Id: I1df5073aaf856fd6e8dfb229b4a39ff776afd6ee
Implements: blueprint kolla kubernetes service exposure
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/44/349044/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. ================================== Kolla Kubernetes Service Exposure ================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/kolla-kubernetes/+spec/kolla-kubernetes-service-exposure Introduction ============ The goal of Kolla Kubernetes cluster is to offer its clients/users the access to OpenStack services running on a kubernetes cluster. Exposing OpenStack services is one the most important part of this solution since if a user cannot access these services, it makes Kolla-Kubernetes useless. Problem description =================== OpenStack services running on Kubernetes cluster use DNS names for flexibility. These names as well as ip addresses associated with these services are internal and external user has no means to discover and to access these name and ip addresses directly. All externally accessible services must be exposed outside of kubernetes cluster. In addition to exposing individual services, a user also need a single reachable ip address to initiate a communication with OpenStack's keystone running on Kolla Kubernetes cluster. Use cases --------- 1. When an external user want to connect and start using OpenStack services, he or she needs to have reachable ip address. 2. In order to authenticate to Kolla-Kubernetes cluster a user must establish connection with Keystone Public end point. 3. In order to access any OpenStack services a user needs a reachable ip address and port. Proposed change =============== 1. First use case can be resolved by a device or a software solution providing VIP functionality, the purpose of this reachable VIP is to serve as an entry point for outside users. All incoming requests for VIP and configured service ports, should be forwarded in round-robin fasion between "COMPUTE" nodes. It is not only allows accessing required service, but also offers loadbalancing and redundancy. 2. Second and third use case are addressed by exposing internal services using Kubernetes NodePort [0]. This feature will map a service port example 9191 to a predefined by kubernetes port (from the range Kubernetes allocates for NodePort). All compute nodes are notified and start listen on this NodePort. If compute node receives traffic destined to NodePort and the corresponding service POD is not running on this compute node, compute node will transfer packet to the compute hosting this pod. Scope ----- The scope of this BP is to ensure that OpenStack service are accessible to outside users. Security impact --------------- Security impact --------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Alternatives ------------ There are other kubernetes features which allow exposing services running on a kubernetes cluster (loadbalancers, ingress) [1] Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- TODO Milestones ---------- TODO Work Items ---------- 1. Agree upon the proposed service exposure technic. 2. Modify service definition templates to include type NodePort. 3. Modify services endpoint registration procedure for externally accessible services to use public VIP address instead of private dns names. Testing ======= This can be tested by introducing an haproxy with VIP configuration and ports redirections to Kubernetes compute nodes. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== [0] http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/services/#type-nodeport [1] http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/ingress/ Issues ========== None

commit_message:
Terms

Add the start of a terminology document.

Change-Id: Ida86356b241518fa16b593a80a46b98374bf8779
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/71/407771/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _terms: ========================= Terms in Kolla-Kubernetes ========================= Overview ======== It is difficult to understand a system and discuss it without using a common set of terminology. This document will try and lay out some common terminology. Terms ===== * Container - A Docker Container provided by the Kolla-Kubernetes project * Package - A Kubernetes Helm package provided by the Kolla-Kubernetes project * Chart - The source code to a Package * Microservice - A Small Package that contain only one Kubernetes object description. The building blocks of larger things. * Release - A single instance of a Package on the running system. * Element - One or more Releases on the system can form a larger usable building block. For example, a rabbit server and a rabbit service are two separate Packages but are instantiated together to form an Element. Multiple Elements using the same Packages can be co'exist on the same system. For example, a rabbit Element for Nova, and a different rabbit Element for Neutron.

commit_message:
add a port number for the keystone-internal service to nova-api-create-cell

the nova-api-create-cell pod can't access the keystone-internal k8s service as the port number(5000) for the service doesn't exist in nova-api-create-cell's values.yaml,
so I add the port as a default

Change-Id: Ia5839955bfda4d8d743063d528ef28bf72cfe3a7
Closes-Bug: #1766753
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/30/564130/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {{- $keystonePort := include "kolla_val_get_str" (dict "key" "port" "searchPath" $keystoneSearchPath "Values" .Values ) | default "5000" }}

commit_message:
Enable the multi-node deployment

 1) add a label for network node
   kubectl label node <node name> kolla_network=true

 2) rebuild OVS microservices for network and compute node
   For network node
   - neutron-openvswitch-agent-network
   - openvswitch-ovsdb-network
   - openvswitch-vswitchd-network

   For compute node
   - neutron-openvswitch-agent-compute
   - openvswitch-ovsdb-compute
   - openvswitch-vswitchd-compute

 3) deploy microservices into each node
   To network node
   - neutron-dhcp-agent
   - neutron-l3-agent-network
   - neutron-metadata-agent-network
   - neutron-openvswitch-agent-network
   - openvswitch-ovsdb-network
   - openvswitch-vswitchd-network

   To compute node
   - nova-compute
   - nova-libvirt
   - neutron-openvswitch-agent-compute
   - openvswitch-ovsdb-compute
   - openvswitch-vswitchd-compute

 4) remove br-ex from compute-node

 5) If multi-node" option in cloud.yaml is false (= AIO
    deployment), OVS microserivces for compute node
    wont be deployed to avoid duplicating deployment.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint multi-node-deployment
Closes-Bug: #1766831

Change-Id: I0c7a07ba0fef372f1e2762bcc41fdaff30a13609

commit_message:
Fixups to deployment guide

I just ran through the deployment guide to deploy a new kolla-kube
and encountered some issues with the docs on the way. Here are the
tweaks I had to make. In addition, this commit also adds a skip option
for kubernetes v1.9.x.

Co-Authored-By: Yushiro FURUKAWA <y.furukawa_2@jp.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I189871946db3c76e09c5b4cfd2a5f6a1aeee8899

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6cb85818f107513a91a891eb8905f0a9a54dc716
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslotest refs/changes/86/572886/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I286299b3ef10c008e73900e0d08a461637796b67
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mox3 refs/changes/74/572874/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Retry journal recording in L3

Since journal recording can fail, and is not run in the same
transaction as router/FIP operations, it will lead to the resource
(router or FIP) to remain altered while a journmal record hasn't been
created.

L3 Flavors should solve this issue comprehensively, but we need a
solution until it's stable, which can also be backported to stable
branches. Hence, this fix should address 99% or the cases.

Change-Id: Ibef0db9a58d86a85ffd948a35db983863999d319
Closes-Bug: #1738246

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for "identity_uri"

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1], this patch replace
port 35357 with 5000 for "identity_uri".
For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: I6c8bf103bc781d3566cf108077383dd976c3a948

commit_message:
Fix sudoers for Ceph

Since moving ansible to a virtualenv in the toolbox Ceph could not run
find_disks.

Change-Id: I8bce61887273f1c27ab79edec947d36a3aab3c48
(cherry picked from commit 9ef9cbeb8f3504a4d80716e5e6ae7e9e6bb372d6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/58/572058/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ansible ALL=(root) NOPASSWD: /opt/ansible/bin/ansible localhost -m find_disks -a *, /usr/local/bin/ansible localhost -m find_disks -a *
deleted_lines: ansible ALL=(root) NOPASSWD: /usr/bin/ansible localhost -m find_disks -a *, /usr/local/bin/ansible localhost -m find_disks -a *

commit_message:
Default some flavor fields loaded from instance

For whatever reason, the non-notification Flavor object
does not provide defaults for disabled, is_public or swap
fields even though the data model does.

Any versioned notifications using the FlavorPayload are
pulling those from the embedded instance.flavor, which
could have been migrated years ago, and might be missing
some fields from the embedded flavor (like these default
ones).

This makes sure that when the Flavor object is deserialized
these fields are checked and if they are not defined then
they are defaulted according to the data model.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I71cdf53cb1904af061216b9ed08b2ceed4aa46e4
Closes-Bug: #1739325

commit_message:
base framework for cyborg client.

Include osc and httpclient lib codes.
In order to avoid reinvent the wheel, most of libs leverage
other openstack projects.

Use this command to list accelerators:
  # openstack accelerator list

ref:
  1. osc plugin
  https://docs.openstack.org/python-openstackclient/latest/contributor/plugins.html#

Change-Id: I90e39267eca3e91ce30807e00525cf637211e29d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 19:27:43.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr/commit/ce39e2aa44408d5288310f0b0cddfd21a31eb5c1', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like

Change-Id: If807d4aba6e1dac661f6a380f4309d4563510106
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If807d4aba6e1dac661f6a380f4309d4563510106
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr refs/changes/08/572908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Stop showing passwords when bootstrap script is ran

Currently this causes bash to echo all lines parsed
and executed; which makes it not so nicely output the
bootstrapping password.

This is not something we should encourage and have show
up in peoples logs or other so stop doing that.

Change-Id: Iac963a5df393d0359b4c8f93b8756ca168f6f193

subject: Only sync the local cell in superconductor mode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-24 00:08:02.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/2b3bb30d9906f70894a1945956fb8216cd929ad0', 'message': "Only sync the local cell in superconductor mode

When nova-manage db sync runs on cell1 in superconductor
mode, the [api_database]/connection config option isn't
set in the config file on purpose so the cell can't
reach the API database.

As a result, the db sync on the cell config can't hit
the API DB to sync cell0, which is not something we need
here anyway, but it results in an error message.

This tells the cell config db sync to just run it on the
cell database and not try to sync cell0.

Change-Id: Iac092762decd6de9e90e264f2998d255e8e40d00
"}]
commit_message:
Only sync the local cell in superconductor mode

When nova-manage db sync runs on cell1 in superconductor
mode, the [api_database]/connection config option isn't
set in the config file on purpose so the cell can't
reach the API database.

As a result, the db sync on the cell config can't hit
the API DB to sync cell0, which is not something we need
here anyway, but it results in an error message.

This tells the cell config db sync to just run it on the
cell database and not try to sync cell0.

Change-Id: Iac092762decd6de9e90e264f2998d255e8e40d00
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/53/555953/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $NOVA_BIN_DIR/nova-manage --config-file $(conductor_conf $i) db sync --local_cell

commit_message:
Set workers=$API_WORKERS in glance-registry.conf

We use $API_WORKERS to throttle the number of workers
in other services but were not doing it for g-reg for
some reason, which by default will run ncpu workers
up to a limit of 8.

Change-Id: Idc81ce05546e6d625c10e2229256eafbe7c057a5
Closes-Bug: #1774781
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/31/571931/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $GLANCE_REGISTRY_CONF DEFAULT workers $API_WORKERS

commit_message:
Add flavor_id argument to router tests.

As neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py is used networking-odl for
functional tests, it ignores flavor data because flavor_id is not
included in hardcoded argument list.

Change-Id: I1826f50233dcf83f991e78d59ce1d3df2bc9013b
Closes-Bug: #1769751

commit_message:
Adds read_only middleware

This patch adds a read_only middleware to swift. It gives the ability
to make an entire cluster or individual accounts read only.
When a cluster or an account is in read only mode, requests that would
result in writes to the cluser are not allowed.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I7e0743aecd60b171bbcefcc8b6e1f3fd4cef2478
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/49/233749/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: read_only = swift.common.middleware.read_only:filter_factory

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 20:08:35.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/vitrage/commit/e2536fa3fafde7eb2ad00a715efca40ddc64fb90', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like

Change-Id: I82c3b74bb0346fa1742a97c00f2b5f3fb26263e9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I82c3b74bb0346fa1742a97c00f2b5f3fb26263e9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/87/572987/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
WIP multi-store support

* Changes for rbd store
* Changes for file store
* Changes for http store (not tested yet)
* Changes for cinder store (not tested yet)

Pending:
* Changes for swift store
* Changes for vmware store
* Changes for sheepdog store

Change-Id: I29bf9dc72f4200a3da146393b3dc209175b8c32e

subject: Ignore keys unsupported by BlazarContext in its creation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 10:09:59.000000000', 'files': ['blazar/tests/test_context.py', 'blazar/context.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/blazar/commit/29e68d829535650e142f8a228cb016e82917979d', 'message': 'Ignore keys unsupported by BlazarContext in its creation

BlazarContext class raises an error when the class is instantiated
with unspported keys. The class is used as a context for RPC and
the RPC is implemented over oslo.messaging. If oslo.messaging
automatically adds a new key for the context, the RPC execution
fails since the new key is unexpected by BlazarContext and it
raises an error.

This patch relaxes the limitations in BlazarContext. If unexpected
keys are passed for the class instantiation, the class ignores the
keys.

Change-Id: Ibdca6eead0ee726bc10a07ee43e4ef10110d23e2
Closes-Bug: #1775363
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore keys unsupported by BlazarContext in its creation

BlazarContext class raises an error when the class is instantiated
with unspported keys. The class is used as a context for RPC and
the RPC is implemented over oslo.messaging. If oslo.messaging
automatically adds a new key for the context, the RPC execution
fails since the new key is unexpected by BlazarContext and it
raises an error.

This patch relaxes the limitations in BlazarContext. If unexpected
keys are passed for the class instantiation, the class ignores the
keys.

Change-Id: Ibdca6eead0ee726bc10a07ee43e4ef10110d23e2
Closes-Bug: #1775363
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/19/572719/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove direct tagging/branching for QA repos

The release process for official OpenStack components
now uses release requests using changes proposed to the
openstack/releases git repository. This allows peer review
of release requests, including version numbers, and run a
series of checks to make sure the release is likely to be
successful once the tag is pushed. The same process
supports the creation of additional repo branches as well.
This all ensures that releases are reported correctly on
the releases.openstack.org website.

As a result of this process, nobody needs to push tags
directly or create branches directly. There were a number
of old QA deliverables with stale ACLs, let's fix them.

Change-Id: I5a098095d87945517fb066a9aa125a481a96118a

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4660a35ff63f3f0212978dda668ba2cb08774e3a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
To cleanup the awaiting-state volume

For deleting all volumes which is in 'awaiting
-state' cleaning the volume transfer after creation
and acceptance.

Change-Id: Ib361289ac0111d92cc42ee2b686809906d58c830
Closes-Bug: #1268481

subject: libvirt: Skip fetching the virtual size of block devices
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-31 10:16:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ad592abbb1ae0630e9ead1099a4a132976c51d06', 'message': 'libvirt: Skip fetching the virtual size of block devices

In this latest episode of `Which CI job has lyarwood broken today?!` we
find that I464bc2b88123a012cd12213beac4b572c3c20a56 introduced a
regression in the nova-lvm experimental job as n-cpu attempted to run
qemu-img info against block devices as an unprivileged user.

For the time being we should skip any attempt to use this command
against block devices until the disk_api layer can make privileged
calls using privsep.

Conflicts:
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict due to
I9616a602ee0605f7f1dc1f47b6416f01895e025b landing in Pike, switching to
the use of the config classes to parse XML within this method.

Closes-bug: #1771700
Change-Id: I9653f81ec716f80eb638810f65e2d3cdfeedaa22

commit_message:
libvirt: Skip fetching the virtual size of block devices

In this latest episode of `Which CI job has lyarwood broken today?!` we
find that I464bc2b88123a012cd12213beac4b572c3c20a56 introduced a
regression in the nova-lvm experimental job as n-cpu attempted to run
qemu-img info against block devices as an unprivileged user.

For the time being we should skip any attempt to use this command
against block devices until the disk_api layer can make privileged
calls using privsep.

Conflicts:
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts due to the substantial refactoring of
_get_instance_disk_info via I9616a602ee0605f7f1dc1f47b6416f01895e025b,
for this change the test has been extended to provide valid XML via the
config classes.

Closes-bug: #1771700
Change-Id: I9653f81ec716f80eb638810f65e2d3cdfeedaa22
(cherry picked from commit fda48219a378d09a9a363078ba161d7f54e32c0a)
(cherry picked from commit 8ea98c56b647526aae7a786531e934eeee7a90a2)
(cherry picked from commit 43cac615f6a0a4399c7bf3dda6c2595749f27ace)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/33/571433/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.storage.lvm.get_volume_size') @mock.patch('nova.virt.disk.api.get_disk_size', new_callable=mock.NonCallableMock) def test_get_instance_disk_info_from_config_block_devices(self, mock_disk_api, mock_get_volume_size): """Test that for block devices the actual and virtual sizes are reported as the same and that the disk_api is not used. """ c = context.get_admin_context() instance = objects.Instance(root_device_name='/dev/vda', **self.test_instance) bdms = objects.BlockDeviceMappingList(objects=[ fake_block_device.fake_bdm_object(c, { 'device_name': '/dev/mapper/vg-lv', 'source_type': 'image', 'destination_type': 'local' }), ]) block_device_info = driver.get_block_device_info(instance, bdms) config = vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuest() disk_config = vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk() disk_config.source_type = "block" disk_config.source_path = mock.sentinel.volume_path config.devices.append(disk_config) mock_get_volume_size.return_value = mock.sentinel.volume_size drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) disk_info = drvr._get_instance_disk_info_from_config(config, block_device_info) mock_get_volume_size.assert_called_once_with(mock.sentinel.volume_path) self.assertEqual(disk_info[0]['disk_size'], disk_info[0]['virt_disk_size'])

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 20:08:18.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/storlets/commit/215efce7716e7a07dfa590d805d5f18598bec22a', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7c8264704ce7c570b981ed40dbe8c37321c170b1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7c8264704ce7c570b981ed40dbe8c37321c170b1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/82/572982/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Integration tests for tagged attach

This tests nova microversion 2.49, tagged attach of network interfaces
and block devices.

Change-Id: I50b9aa168629457ce8270e456161727bd7b91a86
Implements: blueprint virt-device-tagged-attach-detach
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/47/391947/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class DeviceTaggingBase(base.BaseV2ComputeTest): super(TaggedBootDevicesTest, cls).skip_checks() def verify_md_from_api(self, ssh_client, verify_method): md_url = 'http://169.254.169.254/openstack/latest/meta_data.json' def _get_and_verify_metadata(): try: ssh_client.exec_command('curl -V') except exceptions.SSHExecCommandFailed: if not CONF.compute_feature_enabled.config_drive: raise self.skipException('curl not found in guest and ' 'config drive is disabled') LOG.warning('curl was not found in the guest, device tagging ' 'metadata was not checked in the metadata API') return True cmd = 'curl %s' % md_url md_json = ssh_client.exec_command(cmd) verify_method(md_json) if not test.call_until_true(_get_and_verify_metadata, CONF.compute.build_timeout, CONF.compute.build_interval): raise exceptions.TimeoutException('Timeout while verifying ' 'metadata on server.') def verify_md_on_config_drive(self, ssh_client, verify_method) cmd_blkid = 'blkid -t LABEL=config-2 -o device' dev_name = ssh_client.exec_command(cmd_blkid) dev_name = dev_name.rstrip() ssh_client.exec_command('sudo mount %s /mnt' % dev_name) cmd_md = 'sudo cat /mnt/openstack/latest/meta_data.json' md_json = ssh_client.exec_command(cmd_md) verify_method(md_json) class TaggedBootDevicesTest(DeviceTaggingBase): min_microversion = '2.32' max_microversion = 'latest' super(TaggedBootDevicesTest, cls).setup_clients() super(TaggedBootDevicesTest, cls).setup_credentials() super(TaggedBootDevicesTest, cls).resource_setup() def test_boot_with_tagged_devices(self): name=data_utils.rand_name('tagged-boot-devices-net1'))['network'] name=data_utils.rand_name('tagged-boot-devices-net2'))['network'] name=data_utils.rand_name('tagged-boot-devices-server'), ssh_client = remote_client.RemoteClient( self.verify_md_from_api(ssh_client, self.verify_device_metadata) self.verify_md_on_config_drive(ssh_client, self.verify_device_metadata) class TaggedAttachmentsTest(DeviceTaggingBase): min_microversion = '2.39' max_microversion = 'latest' @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super(TaggedAttachmentsTest, cls).setup_clients() cls.volumes_client = cls.os.volumes_client cls.networks_client = cls.os.networks_client cls.interfaces_client = cls.os.interfaces_client @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): cls.set_validation_resources() super(AttachmentsTest, cls).resource_setup() def verify_device_metadata(self, md_json): md_dict = json.loads(md_json) found_devices = [d['tags'][0] for d in md_dict['devices']] self.assertItemsEqual(found_devices, ['nic-tag', 'volume-tag']) def detach_volume(self, server_id, volume_id): self.servers_client.detach(server['id']. volume['id']) waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, volume['id'], 'available') def test_tagged_attachment(self): # Boot test server admin_pass = data_utils.rand_password() server = self.create_test_server(wait_until='ACTIVE', validatable=True, admin_pass=admin_pass) self.addCleanup(waiters.wait_for_server_termination, server['id']) self.addCleanup(self.servers_client.delete_server, server['id']) # Create network net = self.networks_client.create_network( name=data_utils.rand_name('tagged-attachment-test-net'))['network'] self.addCleanup(self.networks_client.delete_network, net['id']) # Create volume volume = self.volumes_client.create_volume(size=1)['volume'] self.addCleanup(self.volumes_client.delete_volume, volume['id']) waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, volume['id'], 'available') # Attach network interface and tag it self.interfaces_client.create_interface(server['id'], net_id=net['id'], tag='nic-tag') # Attach volume and tag it self.servers_client.attach_volume(server['id']. volume['id'], tag='volume-tag') self.addCleanup(waiters.wait_for_volume_status, self.volumes_client, volume['id'], 'available') self.addCleanup(self.detach_volume, server['id'], volume['id']) waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, volume['id'], 'in-use') ssh_client = remote_client.RemoteClient( self.get_server_ip(server), CONF.validation.image_ssh_user, admin_pass, self.validation_resources['keypair']['private_key'], server=server, servers_client=self.servers_client) # Verify metadata on from metadata service if CONF.compute_feature_enabled.metadata_service: self.get_and_verify_metadata(ssh_client, self.verify_device_metadata) # Reboot instance to refresh config drive self.servers_client.reboot_server(server['id'], type='HARD') waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.servers_client, server['id'], 'ACTIVE') # Verify metadata on config drive if CONF.compute_feature_enabled.config_drive: self.verify_md_on_config_drive(ssh_client, self.verify_device_metadata)
deleted_lines: class DeviceTaggingTest(base.BaseV2ComputeTest): min_microversion = '2.32' max_microversion = 'latest' super(DeviceTaggingTest, cls).skip_checks() super(DeviceTaggingTest, cls).setup_clients() super(DeviceTaggingTest, cls).setup_credentials() super(DeviceTaggingTest, cls).resource_setup() def test_device_tagging(self): name=data_utils.rand_name('device-tagging-net1'))['network'] name=data_utils.rand_name('device-tagging-net2'))['network'] name=data_utils.rand_name('device-tagging-server'), self.ssh_client = remote_client.RemoteClient( md_url = 'http://169.254.169.254/openstack/latest/meta_data.json' def get_and_verify_metadata(): try: self.ssh_client.exec_command('curl -V') except exceptions.SSHExecCommandFailed: if not CONF.compute_feature_enabled.config_drive: raise self.skipException('curl not found in guest ' 'and config drive is ' 'disabled') LOG.warning('curl was not found in the guest, device ' 'tagging metadata was not checked in the ' 'metadata API') return True cmd = 'curl %s' % md_url md_json = self.ssh_client.exec_command(cmd) self.verify_device_metadata(md_json) if not test.call_until_true(get_and_verify_metadata, CONF.compute.build_timeout, CONF.compute.build_interval): raise exceptions.TimeoutException('Timeout while verifying ' 'metadata on server.') cmd_blkid = 'blkid -t LABEL=config-2 -o device' dev_name = self.ssh_client.exec_command(cmd_blkid) dev_name = dev_name.rstrip() self.ssh_client.exec_command('sudo mount %s /mnt' % dev_name) cmd_md = 'sudo cat /mnt/openstack/latest/meta_data.json' md_json = self.ssh_client.exec_command(cmd_md) self.verify_device_metadata(md_json)

commit_message:
[WIP] Kubeadm-aio container for kolla-k8s dev and gates

This PS brings in a container for setting up a Kubeadm based
AIO environment for development and gating purposes for Kolla-k8.

Partially-Implements : blueprint devenv-taketwo

and because these tests are very limited, this is not needed. The
tests have been changed to have NoDBTestCase as a grandparent with an

commit_message:
Re-base placement object unit tests on NoDBTestCase

The tests in test_resource_provider.py were originally subclasses of
test_objects._LocalTest because that provided the necessary basics for
testing versioned objects. Since the placement objects do not use RPC
and because these tests are very limited, this is not needed. The
tests have been changed to have NoDBTestCase as a grandparent with an
intervening parent class that sets self.context.

Where required, those tests which uses a database set USES_DB to True.
Subsequent patches will either remove or move these tests to functional
tests where they belong.

Change-Id: Ibf632cd3b4c0cf8fdff44a8a3272c637246f5b52
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/79/572279/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class _TestCase(test.NoDBTestCase): """Base class for other tests in this file. It establishes the RequestContext used as self.context in the tests. """ def setUp(self): super(_TestCase, self).setUp() self.user_id = 'fake-user' self.project_id = 'fake-project' self.context = context.RequestContext(self.user_id, self.project_id) class TestResourceProviderNoDB(_TestCase):class TestProviderSummaryNoDB(_TestCase):# FIXME(cdent): Tests which use the database aren't unit tests. class TestResourceProvider(_TestCase): USES_DB = Trueclass TestInventoryNoDB(_TestCase):class TestInventoryList(_TestCase):# FIXME(cdent): Tests which use the database aren't unit tests. class TestAllocation(_TestCase):class TestAllocationListNoDB(_TestCase):class TestResourceClass(_TestCase):class TestTraits(_TestCase):
deleted_lines: from nova.tests.unit.objects import test_objectsclass TestResourceProviderNoDB(test_objects._LocalTest): USES_DB = Falseclass TestProviderSummaryNoDB(test_objects._LocalTest): USES_DB = Falseclass TestResourceProvider(test_objects._LocalTest):class TestInventoryNoDB(test_objects._LocalTest): USES_DB = Falseclass TestInventoryList(test_objects._LocalTest):class TestAllocation(test_objects._LocalTest):class TestAllocationListNoDB(test_objects._LocalTest): USES_DB = Falseclass TestResourceClass(test.NoDBTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestResourceClass, self).setUp() self.user_id = 'fake-user' self.project_id = 'fake-project' self.context = context.RequestContext(self.user_id, self.project_id)class TestTraits(test.NoDBTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestTraits, self).setUp() self.user_id = 'fake-user' self.project_id = 'fake-project' self.context = context.RequestContext(self.user_id, self.project_id)

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: If3383707c9baf69e03bcccc50970da748a834141

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifeed5b9c1357cbb00502c8c7d2932a5e2ad2e2a6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy refs/changes/79/572879/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Added release notes for Rocky first release

Change-Id: I4b95ac68cb6f0edc1938fed3ca85dda5fcc575d5
Co-Authored-By: Idan Hefetz <idan.hefetz@nokia.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/88/572688/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - ``RPC collector`` - the collector service was changed to run on demand instead of periodically, hence it can now be run in active-active mode. This is as part of a larger design to improve high availability. - Oslo service was replaced by cotyledon, so Vitrage uses real threads and multiprocessing. This change removes unnecessary complications of using eventlets and timers. - Created a dedicated process for the api handler, for better handling api calls under stress.

commit_message:
Add new states for container

This patch applies new container states as follows:
* DELETING
* REBUILDING
* DEAD
* RESTARTING

Also, update validations for actions.

Change-Id: I42394eb04dcc9a224ccdc230f4773e3531d1306c

commit_message:
Install EPEL repositories manually and exclude Python packages

The EPEL repositories currently have conflicts with the OpenStack
RDO packages.  However, we don't need any Python packages from
EPEL therefore this will solve the conflicts and it will not
let it pull anything from EPEL.

Change-Id: I5fc6b4cbcd3d8ad207477603591f82ea8243a1c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts refs/changes/55/573055/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mirrorlist: "{{ repo.mirrorlist | default(omit) }}" exclude: "{{ repo.gpgcheck | default(omit) }}"

commit_message:
Add new options for container creation

This patch adds following options for container creation.
* auto_heal
* disk
* availablity_zones

Also, add these parameters into details views to show.
And change layouts to add these options.

This change requires python-zunclient 1.4.0 or later.

Change-Id: Ibb9e774ea379a9999c703d6919f14dd0a6e56857
Implements: blueprint add-params-rocky-1
Depends-On: I6c0512816277a63bbf444d0775121bb5d964a36a

commit_message:
Allow setting network-segment on subnet update

To enable the possibility to migrate a non-routed network to a
routed network allow updating the segment_id of a subnet.

Change-Id: I3ebae2ff28d5d4e5373ebd1f52194f8c52071b88
Partial-Bug: bug/1692490
Depends-On: I1aee29dfb59e9769ec0f1cb1f5d2933bc5dc0dc5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/74/523974/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Add ``--network-segment`` option to ``subnet set`` command. This enables the possiblity to set the ``segment_id`` of a subnet on update.

commit_message:
DNM Debug hosts

/etc/hosts is prepared for multinode, but its content does not help
with qemu name resultion during live migration.

http://paste.openstack.org/show/722649/

Debug to understand what's wrong (probably inventory names are injected
instead of proper hostnames.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/572313
Change-Id: Ib815cfe91af5bf9e526f57a2676008e8ce77975f

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I21491f302cbc6ca7a9b5ac12c487cf214bf4866e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware refs/changes/07/572907/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[Fullstack] Limit number of Neutron's api workers

Default number of api workers in Neutron is set to be equal to
number of CPU cores on host. That is fine on production environment
but on fullstack tests, where each test spawns own neutron-server
process it might cause host overload.

This patch limits number of api_workers to 2 which should be enough
for single test case and should make significantly lower load on host.

Change-Id: I1e970e35883d5240f0bd30eaea50313d93900580
Closes-Bug: #1750337
(cherry picked from commit 465ad6f3197b8591a401a9f0db2fabf6c70fdfce)

commit_message:
Don't share a network with all tenants

Other tenants may appreciate random networks not popping up for
miliseconds in their net-list; and other test cases executed in parallel
may also benefit, especially when they e.g. attempt to validate net-list
result; or boot an instance w/o specifying a port or network to use.

There is still more work on tempest tests side.

Original patch was for neutron-tempest-plugin:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550987/
and this is only backport to stable/Pike branch which still
uses tempest tests from neutron repo.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571676/
Change-Id: I88eaa1bb65482557912c2d304800d782e730a6b6
Closes-Bug: #1753209

commit_message:
Fix eventlet imports issue

With Ubuntu python package 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.3 and
evetlet < 0.22.0 there is some issue with eventlet monkey_patching.
This commit adds workaround solution ported from eventlet patch
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/b756447bab51046dfc6f1e0e299cc997ab343701

Change-Id: Ia381c98116765903bf2652acd175251233df4e54
Closes-Bug: #1745013
(cherry picked from commit 04efb3bca33cb4ca49f29e548866ad6f5d0ed359)

commit_message:
Don't skip DVR port while neutron-openvswitch-agent is restared.

neutron-openvswitch-agent will refresh flows when it's restarted.
But the port's binding status is not changed, update_port_postcommit
will be skipped at function '_update_individual_port_db_status' in
'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', l2pop don't handle DVR ports, the
fdb entries about DVR port will not be added.

So, we can't skip DVR port at notify_l2pop_port_wiring when agent
is restared.

Closes-Bug: #1773286
Change-Id: I54e3db4822830a0c83daf7b5150575f8d6e2497b
(cherry picked from commit d0fa2c9ac50a783c410fab2df938974c4e829ffa)

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id7f0cc773ddc6bdcf464574fc7faa9216db71e09
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifc418b2911ec09d1f7968ffb3d3e4093f6d07d6c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qinling refs/changes/77/572977/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
replace file() with open() for python 3 compatibility

The built-in name 'file' does not exist under python 3, so replace it
with 'open', which is the same under python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: Ic1ff9308b1ab0bda8d49a556620bb22ca5407b5e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Adding image membership check to _is_image_available

This adds a condition for valid membership where the image visibility is
'shared', the current project matches a member_id of the image and that
member's status is 'accepted'.  If all of these conditions are true,
then the current project has access to the image.  This check is
performed after other checks since it requires querying for membership
information from Glance so it will only affect membership checks that
were likely to fail already (due to having failed all previous checks).

Change-Id: Ifdcf7c5eab435b0dc40dd3650b61ebfef1e5579e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/49/557749/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _is_image_available(self, context, image): if image.visibility == 'shared': for member in self.list_members(context, image.id): if (context.project_id == member['member_id'] and member['status'] == 'accepted'): return True

commit_message:
Add gating for all supported OS for SSL

If we want to make sure that SSL is working, let's guarantee
it for all of our deployment targets.

Change-Id: Ib381d61188da8ba3788b433a17a389c6e67a73a1

commit_message:
Remove CA API policy file

The CAs API was removed some months ago [1], but this file was left
there. It generates noise when outputting the policy file.

[1] Iead0336a19ce58b8b2bb1f9af5e6dd3688fe91fc

Change-Id: I5452633e2d1de0970f2cd47c38b19f288d87db13

commit_message:
Fix GCS backup driver docs

Change If1e34ea112b0cff328a58ec2fc9c3f5a5005f1c6 renamed the Google
backup driver, but the configuration docs for the driver were not
updated. This results in the incorrect driver name being provided
for backup driver configuration and local document builds failing
due to no configuration options being found when looking for them
in the old location.

Change-Id: I40fa544892ed9ea9fb5975baeafb7c9a7e2f12a3

commit_message:
Add contributor docs on deprecating and removing compute REST APIs

Deprecating APIs with microversions is a long-established pattern
at this point, but the docs don't mention it at all, so this
adds a short description of what happens there.

We removed the os-certificates and os-cloudpipe APIs in Pike
and the os-fping API in Rocky, and there is a pattern to removal
also, so this adds detailed documentation on the steps involved
in removing a deprecated API.

Change-Id: I9fdb9ce78c45d27d3c7f55fcbda0f763dfb66d66

commit_message:
Remove support for /os-fping REST API

This drops support for the fping compute REST API which
has been deprecated since Newton:

  I1a8a44530be29292561e90d6f7bd7ed512a88ee3

To match the os-cloudpipe and os-certificates removals
the os-fping controller now returns a 410 response.

The related fping_path configuration option is removed
along with the related fping policy rules.

Unit tests are removed and the functional API sample
test is just asserting the 410 response now.

The API sample docs are left intact since the API reference
still builds from those and can be considered more or
less branchless, so people looking at the API reference
can apply it to older deployments of nova before os-fping
was removed.

A release note is started which we can build on for each
nova-network specific API that we remove in this series.

Part of blueprint remova-nova-network

Change-Id: Ia36aaa8f74adc2b540c49523db522cd85ab17ed2

commit_message:
Test Django default test runner

horizon blueprint improve-horizon-testing will change
the test runner from nose to the django default test runner.

This commit is to test the django default test runner.
The verbosity is increased to check which tests are executed.

After switching the test runner, the number of tests executed
will be changed from 349 to 348. The only difference is
manila_ui.tests.test_data.utils.load_test_data which has no
actual test. nose seems to recognize this as a test based on
its filename but this is not true, so this is not a problem.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544296/
Change-Id: I5aba373dc6ad0acb6a5e14dff3799d4caf64de23

commit_message:
Revert "Rename fernet_utils to token_utils"

This reverts commit 03ba867327fe950d3240fdbd6d207a8c0550e2c5.

Because of the introduction of auth receipts we will be
using fernet for more than just tokens. Lets make this a
generic util for fernet key handling.

Change-Id: I3a870a63239491f84db3350178bd2313eeccdbf3

subject: Add nova-manage placement heal_allocations CLI
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-02 19:47:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7f2207168414d5f374ab5db7e86630d6ebc09088', 'message': "WIP: Add nova-manage placement heal_allocations CLI

TODO: tests and docs

This adds a new CLI which will iterate all non-cell0
cells looking for instances that (1) have a host,
(2) aren't undergoing a task state transition and
(3) don't have allocations in placement and try
to allocate resources, based on the instance embedded
flavor, against the compute node resource provider
on which the instance is currently running.

This is meant as a way to help migrate CachingScheduler
users off the CachingScheduler by first shoring up
instance allocations in placement for any instances

commit_message:
Add nova-manage placement heal_allocations CLI

This adds a new CLI which will iterate all non-cell0
cells looking for instances that (1) have a host,
(2) aren't undergoing a task state transition and
(3) don't have allocations in placement and try
to allocate resources, based on the instance embedded
flavor, against the compute node resource provider
on which the instance is currently running.

This is meant as a way to help migrate CachingScheduler
users off the CachingScheduler by first shoring up
instance allocations in placement for any instances
created after Pike, when the nova-compute resource
tracker code stopped creating allocations in placement
since the FilterScheduler does it at the time of
scheduling (but the CachingScheduler doesn't).

This will be useful beyond just getting deployments
off the CachingScheduler, however, since operators
will be able to use it to fix incorrect allocations
resulting from failed operations.

There are several TODOs and NOTEs inline about things
we could build on top of this or improve, but for now
this is the basic idea.

Change-Id: Iab67fd56ab4845f8ee19ca36e7353730638efb21

added_lines: from nova.scheduler.client import report from nova.scheduler import utils as scheduler_utilsclass PlacementCommands(object): """Commands for managing placement resources.""" @staticmethod def _get_compute_node_uuid(ctxt, instance, node_cache): """Find the ComputeNode.uuid for the given Instance :param ctxt: cell-targeted RequestContext :param instance: the instance to lookup a compute node :param node_cache: dict of Instance.node keys to ComputeNode.uuid values; this cache is updated if a new node is processed. :returns: ComputeNode.uuid for the given instance, else None if the compute node could not be found by host and node name. """ if instance.node in node_cache: return node_cache[instance.node] try: compute_node = objects.ComputeNode.get_by_host_and_nodename( ctxt, instance.host, instance.node) except exception.ComputeHostNotFound: return None node_uuid = compute_node.uuid node_cache[instance.node] = node_uuid return node_uuid @args('--max-count', metavar='<max_count>', dest='max_count', help='Maximum number of instances to process. If not specified, all ' 'instances in each cell will be mapped in batches of' '``[api]/max_count`` (default 1000). If you have a large ' 'number of instances, consider specifying a custom value and ' 'run the command until it exits with 0.') @args('--verbose', metavar='<verbose>', action='store_true', dest='verbose', default=False, help='Provide verbose output during execution.') def heal_allocations(self, max_count=None, verbose=False): """Heals instance allocations in the Placement service Iterates over non-cell0 cells looking for instances which do not have allocations in the Placement service and which are not undergoing a task state transition. For each instance found, allocations are created against the compute node resource provider for that instance based on the flavor associated with the instance. This commands requires that the ``[api_database]/connection`` and ``[placement]`` configuration options are set. Return codes: * 0: Command completed successfully. * 1: --max-count was reached and there are more instances to process. * 2: Unable to find a compute node record for a given instance. * 3: Unable to create allocations for an instance against its compute node resource provider. * 127: Invalid input. """ # NOTE(mriedem): Thoughts on ways to expand this: # - add a --dry-run option to just print which instances were hit # - allow passing a specific cell to heal # - allow filtering on enabled/disabled cells # - allow passing a specific instance to heal # - add a force option to force allocations for instances which have # task_state is not None (would get complicated during a migration) # - add an option to overwrite allocations for instances which already # have allocations (but the operator thinks might be wrong?); this # would probably only be safe with a specific instance. if max_count is not None: try: max_count = int(max_count) except ValueError: max_count = -1 if max_count < 1: print(_('Must supply a positive integer for --max-count.')) return 127 else: # FIXME(mriedem): This batch size is probably too large; consider # that we pull back 1000 instances but by the time we get to # process #999 it is undergoing a task_state transition. max_count = CONF.api.max_limit ctxt = context.get_admin_context() cells = objects.CellMappingList.get_all() if not cells: if verbose: print(_('No cells to process.')) return 0 # NOTE(mriedem): Should we just use a simple KSA Adapter here? placement = report.SchedulerReportClient() # TODO(mriedem): Would it be better to get all instances without # the filters so we have a total count per cell, and then filter out # the ones that have task_state set, to give an indication that there # is more to do? filters = {'task_state': None} num_processed = 0 # Keep a cache of instance.node to compute node resource provider UUID. # This will save some lookups for non-ironic instances to the # compute_nodes table. node_cache = {} # TODO(mriedem): Use context.scatter_gather_skip_cell0. for cell in cells: # Skip cell0 since that is where instances go that do not get # scheduled and hence would not have allocations against a host. if cell.uuid == objects.CellMapping.CELL0_UUID: continue if verbose: print(_('Looking for instances in cell: %s') % cell.identity) # Get all instances from this cell which have a host and are not # undergoing a task state transition. with context.target_cell(ctxt, cell) as cctxt: instances = objects.InstanceList.get_by_filters( cctxt, filters, limit=max_count, expected_attrs=['flavor']) if verbose: print(_('Found %s candidate instances.') % len(instances)) # For each instance in this list, we need to see if it has # allocations in placement and if so, assume it's correct and # continue. for instance in instances: if instance.node is None: if verbose: print(_('Instance %s is not on a host.') % instance.uuid) continue allocations = placement.get_allocations_for_consumer( ctxt, instance.uuid) if allocations: if verbose: print(_('Instance %s already has allocations.') % instance.uuid) continue # Make sure we don't go over the max count. Note that we # don't include instances that already have allocations in the # max_count number, only the number of instances that have # successfully created allocations. if num_processed == max_count: if verbose: print(_('Max count reached. Processed %s instances.') % num_processed) return 1 # This instance doesn't have allocations so we need to find # it's compute node resource provider. with context.target_cell(ctxt, cell) as cctxt: node_uuid = ( self._get_compute_node_uuid( cctxt, instance, node_cache)) if node_uuid is None: print(_('Unable to find compute host for ' 'instance: %s') % instance.uuid) return 2 # Now get the resource allocations for the instance based # on its embedded flavor. resources = scheduler_utils.resources_from_flavor( instance, instance.flavor) if placement.put_allocations( ctxt, node_uuid, instance.uuid, resources, instance.project_id, instance.user_id): num_processed += 1 if verbose: print(_('Successfully created allocations for ' 'instance %(instance)s against resource ' 'provider %(provider)s.') % {'instance': instance.uuid, 'provider': node_uuid}) else: print(_('Failed to create allocations for instance ' '%(instance)s against resource provider ' '%(provider)s.') % {'instance': instance.uuid, 'provider': node_uuid}) return 3 if verbose: print(_('Processed %s instances.') % num_processed) return 0 'placement': PlacementCommands

commit_message:
Replace rabbitmq references with oslo messaging

This removes, everywhere applicable, the reference
_rabbitmq_, replacing it with the new oslo
counterpart. Shims for compatibility are explicitly
referenced, so that we can remove them later, when
the roles have been adapted appropriately.

It explicitly puts all the oslo messaging details
in one place, as this is easier to track. It is
applied on the all group, as most of the time, the
details are used by 2 or more roles.

This also updated spice-html5 git repository URL
as their code moved out of github. This also adds
some details in job log collection in order to be
able to gather more information about failures.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572413/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572565/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560574/

subject: Don't rely on pbr ChangeLog for docs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-24 20:38:59.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/history.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware/commit/bcdec1acfa0286a865312b0b3def49076ccb81c4', 'message': "Don't rely on pbr ChangeLog for docs

The ChangeLog file is generated when we run `python setup.py sdist`,
which doesn't naturally happen when we run `tox -edocs`, so on a fresh
clone the docs build will fail because it references the ChangeLog file
which isn't there. Since we don't rely on pbr any more for release notes

"}]
commit_message:
Don't rely on pbr ChangeLog for docs

The ChangeLog file is generated when we run `python setup.py sdist`,
which doesn't naturally happen when we run `tox -edocs`, so on a fresh
clone the docs build will fail because it references the ChangeLog file
which isn't there. Since we don't rely on pbr any more for release notes
and we have a sophisticated release note management tool, point the docs
at the published release notes instead of the pbr ChangeLog.

Change-Id: I614091eae739154337795a8f120b68686ad0ed0a

commit_message:
Switch coverage tox env to stestr

We already switched the unit tests to follow the updated PTI
guidelines[1] but neglected to switch the coverage environment. Do that
now.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/pti/python.html#python-test-running

Change-Id: Ie153516196f18c030ea58e76a0eac15c86169c6b

commit_message:
Remove unused policy rules

This removes the admin_or_user_does_not_work and the admin_or_user
policy rules, which are not used anywhere else, and effectively just
generate noise in the policy file.

commit_message:
Remove references to internal PyKMIP implementation details

This change removes and replaces references to internal PyKMIP
implementation details with alternatives that support backwards
compatibility. These changes should be compliant with PyKMIP
0.7 (the current release) and PyKMIP 0.8 (the upcoming release).

Change-Id: I419680076a8eb43a98ef21474328ed8b4d267067

commit_message:
Fix node health validation with inventory changes

The inventory now uses host names in groups instead of IPs which cannot be
directly used to ping hosts in the node health validation.

The IPs are now collected from the meta hostvars dictionary.

Change-Id: I75f3dcd5e29ae26fdc65ef093f8c207163ed1fff

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia4382a110fbfb61c86157088ea31bd55c8bcbc53
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Correct usage of transport_url in example

The example usage of transport_url in ConfFixture was not corrected when
the rest of the code was switched to using 'fake:/' for transport_url.
Since other projects will refer to this example to review changes, it
should be correct.

Also change the transport URLs used in test_transport to correspond to
the correct way of specifying virtual hosts.

Change-Id: If8e0a869e02fda2d8d2c86d82ef83ffc3a4361e4

commit_message:
Add warning output if failed to rebuild exception when deserialize

In some specific cases, the middleware would fail to rebuild
the original exception, see bug [1] below. Adding this output
may help locate the root cause quickly.

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1728826

Change-Id: Ia9304bda4e515812b146885f830e70f28a285f2d

commit_message:
Revert "Add Zuulv3 jobs for puppet functional testing"

This reverts commit 0474b75e86fe8ade257bfea9b92cab9aed6ada1f.

Since the general consensus is to just keep puppet on life support
until we're ready for a new config management system, it's not
worth the effort to convert our beaker-rspec tests to a new thing.

Change-Id: I275443442ced5c76ec016b66b957bee28dea40dc

commit_message:
Replace neutron ovsfw job with iptables_hybrid

In patch [1] neutron-tempest-ovsfw job was switched to be
neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid job as openvswitch firewall is
now set as default fw driver by devstack.
So we need to update our grafana dashboard according to this
change.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571692/

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571692/
Change-Id: Ic6d9019a928872c2fe4f7c2ce71473beb2244652

commit_message:
Add optional support for retrying certain HTTP codes

Ironic commonly returns HTTP 409 when a node is locked by another routine
and HTTP 503 when the conductor has no free threads to process the request.
Currently it is managed by custom code in ironicclient and openstacksdk,
this change will allow to move it to Session itself.

Change-Id: I04e356e7856b020cd20aa598e291ef31e02730d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/34/570934/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ib71942ec6f5e9f55d6a1f151c0e97b657167905d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslosphinx refs/changes/85/572885/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Add flag to enable QoS DSCP marking in ODL

In OpenDaylight, a config parameter is available to enable DSCP
marking inheritance for packets egressing out of OVS through
VXLAN/GRE tunnels.

Add a flag in TripleO to enable this parameter via puppet-opendaylight.

Change-Id: I3b192c8fc1bc92c1124d3b27c60ad5c0c4dd42f9
(cherry picked from commit bdd51e937ac81d789c50b0569cafde1d134632f8)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/67/572867/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | In OpenDaylight, a config parameter is available to enable DSCP marking inheritance for packets egressing out of OVS through VXLAN/GRE tunnels. Add a flag "OpenDaylightInheritDSCPMarking" in TripleO to enable this parameter via puppet-opendaylight. If the flag is set to 'true', DSCP marking feature is enabled in OpenDaylight.

commit_message:
Add flag to enable QoS DSCP marking in ODL

In OpenDaylight, a config parameter is available to enable DSCP
marking inheritance for packets egressing out of OVS through
VXLAN/GRE tunnels.

Add a flag in TripleO to enable this parameter via puppet-opendaylight.

Change-Id: I3b192c8fc1bc92c1124d3b27c60ad5c0c4dd42f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/59/570859/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | In OpenDaylight, a config parameter is available to enable DSCP marking inheritance for packets egressing out of OVS through VXLAN/GRE tunnels. Add a flag "OpenDaylightInheritDSCPMarking" in TripleO to enable this parameter via puppet-opendaylight. If the flag is set to 'true', DSCP marking feature is enabled in OpenDaylight.

commit_message:
Add glance-eventlet-ssl-handshake-broken-py35 job

Blacklist the two currently skipped functional-py35 tests and
include them in a new non-voting job so that their failure is
obvious instead of hidden.

Change-Id: Ice8e114c6590b25f3ec79fbe4c06efaa245706c0
Partial-bug: #1769006
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/40/571040/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: whitelist_externals = bash # NOTE(rosmaita): calling this script is a complete hack, everything # is hard-coded. bash tools/generate-blacklist.sh {toxinidir} {envtmpdir} stestr run --blacklist-file {envtmpdir}/func-py35-blacklist.txt {posargs}[testenv:broken-py35-ssl-tests] # NOTE(rosmaita): these tests were being skipped due to bug #1482633, but we # want it to be obvious that Glance is affected by the eventlet ssl-handshake # problem under py35. (When this testenv is removed, don't forget to adjust # the blacklist generation in the functional-py35 testenv.) basepython = python3.5 setenv = TEST_PATH = ./glance/tests/functional commands = stestr run --whitelist-file ./broken-functional-py35-ssl-tests.txt {posargs}
